Reviews.Title: “Don't judge by external appearance - its warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: jennyfloss
Reviews.Content: The main reasons I rate this hotel so highly is that the rooms are spotlessely clean and very comfortable and that guests' needs are well catered for. For instance feather pillows are available for people like me - I just cannot sleep on hollowfibre pillows. When in London on business I always book Holiday Inn Bloomsbury as I have found it to be the only one where I get a good night's sleep which is crucial for work. The staff here are all extremely welcoming and friendly and many have been there a long time and recognise repeat guests which is always nice. The location is excellent and within walking distance of Euston, St Pancras and Kings Cross. I cannot agree with some of the negative reviews, I have been staying here for nearly 10 years and have never seen a mouse. Its not the prettiest hotel but the rooms are a good size, comfortable, staff are warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a top secret hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meitiner
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to London for my birthday recently and were looking for a hotel that would be close to the New London Theatre as we were watching War Horse. We decided to go for the Last Minute 4* Secret Hotel deal which turned out to be the Holiday Inn. We were a little disappointed as first as I wouldn't necessarily class the chain as 4*, however we went with an open mind. The lobby was great and the staff were brilliant. However the room was tiny. The bed seemed smaller than the double we have at home. The heating was on max which made it like a sauna. We had to climb behind the telly to turn it off and had to put the air con as low as possible to try and cool the room down. The bathroom was miniscule. It was actually quite hard to close the door once you were in there (like those tiny cubicles in some bars and restaurants!). Anyhow, it was a great location and we are aware that in London you pay for location so we were happy with the price we paid. Or we were until we tried to sleep! The plumbing was extremely noisy. I am a heavy sleeper but it even woke me up. Everytime someone in the hotel went to the toilet it sounded like they had flush our loo! And it is a big hotel, and there was a lot of people going to the toilet throughout the night! Not a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Mice”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was wonderful, however, I was mortified to see mice in the hotel. The staff did not seem to believe me or care. I looked for another hotel in the area but most were either booked or more expensive. Be very careful with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Adequte, clean, typically small, soul-less”
Reviews.Author: susaninlondon
Reviews.Content: There for a quick one night stay in London; chosen for the central location and price. Used to stay at the Strand Palace, but they have jumped up there prices outrageously. Was able to get a room from £110 - but if I had paid a rack rate I would have been very grumpy! The rooms are small, no surprise; but well designed, with space to put things. It was quiet, and the bed was comfortable, with the new rage, pillow menus... Don't expect a large range of amenities in the bathroom though! Plenty of towels for one person, might of been a push for two (of course the room itself would have been a push for two). The thing is, if you just need a place to put your head for the night, with no surprises, this works. IF you want a place that charms you, that makes you feel special and pampered....well why are you looking at the Holiday Inns anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MR_S1_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. In all the hotel has good staff and decent facilities (including an Irish pub with well priced beer) but the room I was given was tiny and much smaller than normal rooms. I assume this is because I booked on price line for a rate much lower than usual. It still had a comfortable bed and I was really only in the room to sleep anyway so it served that purpose well. Finally the location is outstanding. Literally a 2 minute walk from Russell Square tube station which is on the Picadilly line so no connections required to get to/form Heathrow. Obviously very close to all in central London and a great area to wander around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Iain K
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay here but couldn't criticise anything about it. From checking in to checking out everything was great. The room was clean, spacious and extremely comfy. The staff were extremely helpful and offered assistance without being intrusive. The location is fantastic with Russell Square tube station literally around the corner. The breakfast was plentiful and of good standard. Will be staying here again for any subsequent business visits to the capital. Enjoy, I know you will.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: knsv
Reviews.Content: Good location in Bloomsbury, next to Russel Square station. Close to public transport with underground and busses. Bus no 7 takes you down Oxford Street, all the way to Marble Arch. Bus no 168 takes you up to Camden Town. The hotel is large but very nice. Typical Holiday Inn rooms, but well-kept and very clean. I think this is one of the few hotels I have stayed in with a television with good quality. The breakfast buffet is very good but the restaurant can be a little noisy and crowded, special during the weekends. The only downside is the rate of internet. I found it very expensive, and luckily there are free internet in pubs and bars close to the hotel. I will stay here again and can recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayess00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and will happily do so again. Its location is excellent, round the corner from Russell Square tube station and next door to the Brunswick Centre which has a good variety of eateries, shops and entertainment. Walking to Covent Garden, Oxford Street or Kings Cross is easy or you can hop on one of the frequent buses to go further afield. The lobby is bright, modern and spacious. The Reception staff and Concierge are friendly, efficient and professional as are the Housekeeping staff when you meet them in the corridors. I haven't eaten or drunk there so can't comment on the restaurant or bar. Our room was on the first floor which is also where there are several training suites and conference rooms. There was some noise from the corridor - I got woken up by people talking at 4.30 am one night - but generally it felt pretty quiet. I think it was an executive room - we had a small separate lounge area with a sofa, desk and table. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean, with good quality toiletries. There were complimentary bottles of mineral water replenished every day and a kitkat chunky on arrival. We didn't use the safe or the minibar. A couple of slight irritations: I would have liked to sit on the sofa and watch TV but that wasn't possible due to a large pillar in the middle of the room. It would also be nice to have had a docking station in the room. And there is a hefty charge for internet access which generally means I end up leaving the hotel and buying snacks and drinks somewhere with free wifi. But overall this is a fine hotel and an excellent ambassador for the Holiday Inn brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for London stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on numerous occasions here both on business and leisure. The hotel is very efficiently run and extremely clean. The staff are very attentive and friendly whilst always maintaining their professionalism. Even when travelling on business I look forward to staying here - a great oasis after a busy day. I really appreciate the staff remembering my name! Highly recommended for any stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably suit all!”
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: Probably every type of traveller would find plusses in this hotel. Very close to an underground station, supermarkets near, pubs and local resteraunts within 20-100yds. Covent Garden easily walkable, as is Theatreland. Clean, light and modern. A very good base.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break.”
Reviews.Author: DollyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel.Staff very helpful and attentive.Very clean.Tv didnt work but told staff and was sorted straight away.Breakfast fab continental and english.Nice location.Im loving it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer13
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely place to stay during a weekend visit to London. Close to the tube and with lots of nice bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. The room was clean and spacious and the staff very helpful. Highly recommended for a sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Zak000
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to from Russell Square Tube, two minutes walk! Very quick check in and nice clean reception and great welcome from the front of house on arrival. We had a double room which yes is not massive but it is all you need, comfy bed with choice of pillows, good TV, hairdryer wardrobe/drawer space, desk etc... If you forget anything like toothbrush/shaving etc reception will sort it out free of charge. Their were only a couple of downsides to the room but believe me did not ruin our stay. The first being the complimentary in room tea tray. They have a thing about sugar in this hotel from our experience, unless you don't take sugar or only want one each take some of your own lol! The maid came in the after our first nights stay and left us with only one towel between us and did not re stock the tea tray so had no sugar and not enough milk and dirty mugs. We did go down to reception and ask for more towels and re-stock. Reception were very friendly and said it would be sorted, alas it was not. Second was the service panel in the wardrobe that kept falling out and making a large bang but again did not ruin our stay. The bar is very comfortable and friendly and the snacks/bar food is fabulous (huge portions) and served with a smile! Everything is in easy reach, Covent Garden, West End, Train Stations, Soho etc. We had room service several times and they always delivered on time. Room service 24 hour menu is vast and again portions MASSIVE! We ate at the hotel a lot as food was great and it suited our schedule. Overall if I was to book again in London would go back. I have stayed in other hotels in London and would chose to go back to this one due to the excellent facilities. Although other hotels have had larger rooms we paid a premium and did not have the room service that Holiday Inn provided. We stayed on 3rd floor and it was quiet for central London. If I was to stay as a family I would also go back to this hotel. Thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melcar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so conveniently placed, literally minutes from Russel Square Tube Station. The Reception Staff, and indeed all the staff, were extremely friendly & helpful. The food was very good & breakfast superb. The Standard rooms are quite small, the bathroom is very tiny but I must say they were immaculately clean. Towels & line good quality and brilliant white. Could really have done with a comforatble chair as to relax one would have to sit on the bed - not ideal. Although being Priority members it was much cheaper to book with a third party, shaving over £100 of the price. The rack rate advertised on the wall was £419 prpn this is far to expensive for what you get. Nonetheless I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: sandwiches71
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 15 others for a day/night in London. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The staff are friendly, welcoming and attentive even working out whether a van is cheaper than a taxi! I stayed on the 5th floor in a twin room which was clean, and the bed was really comfortable. Perfectly positioned for Russell Square tube station, there's a shopping centre with a Boots, florist, Waitrose etc and Tesco express with in a short walk. Would happily stay again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Good job i didn't want to swing a cat.”
Reviews.Author: leeroy f
Reviews.Content: Twas a bit cramped in our room on the fourth floor, so much so that i tripped over the bed and spotted 2 cigarette ends on the floor under the tv desk whilst picking myself up. there are no opening windows which is a bit of a shame if you like fresh air. we were pleased with the substantial breakfast though, but only because we were first to arrive as by the time we left it had turned into a riotous free for all. the front desk team were uninterested in answering our questions,pointing us to a leaflet stand in the corner without uttering a word. bordering on rude. On the plus side .....Great location for city access. That is all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WindsorKP
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive room & it was a large room! Very nice! The bathroom was also large. The Irish bar attached was great to have an afternoon beer! I thought this was a great hotel. The only negative, it's a little out of the way for shopping but the tube just got used more than usual,,

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms at high cost.”
Reviews.Author: TheBagCarrier
Reviews.Content: Despite staying in an "executive room" it would have been hard to swing an executive cat in it! The bathroom had water stains on the surface around the sink. On a positive note the staff were efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jane M
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the holiday inn - great service and so close to tube station. This hotel is situated perfecttly if your sightseeing in and aroung London city centre. Would def return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MikePGreenville_SC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights Thur-Sun. The hotel is truly 100 yards from the Russell Square tube stop. There is a modern pub adjacent to the hotel that serves meals, shows live sporting events, and has a safe, fun atmosphere. The hotel also has an "after hours" bar for hotel guests. Check in was efficient and friendly. The room was modern, and included a bath with a shower. The bed was comfortable. The TV was a large HDTV with approximately 20 channels, several in other languages. The room was very quiet with almost no street noise. I noticed the room has air conditioning although I did not need it due to the time of year. The room included a coffee / tea service. We did not eat at the hotel so I can not comment on the food / restaurant experience. Overall the hotel appeared to be very clean and well managed. Check out was also efficiently handled. They even arranged for a car service to transport us to the train station. The area surrounding the hotel is very quiet and safe. There are several grocery store / convenience store type shops around the hotel. They stay open quite late and should have most needs covered. One evening we walked from the hotel to Covent Garden and Leicester Square. It took approximately 30 minutes (one way) and was a safe, fun walk. I would definately stay at this hotel again. I would recommend the hotel for solo's, families, couples, and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: H0lly_Days
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a long awaited break. Although clean the rooms are minute for the price. Had to walk sideways to get around the foot of the bed, which incidently was too soft. No space for a bedside cabinet on the side nearest to the wardobe. Wardrobe was open as no space for doors!! The bathroom was tiny and sitting on the loo you could almost touch all four walls without much effort. To top all that on the first night we had an extremely inconsiderate guest waking us up at 1.00am in the corridor outside our room, the disturbance continuing until 3.00am!! The only good thing about this hotel was the location being close to Russell Square tube station and within walking distance of Covent Garden. That said we enjoyed our weekend but probably wouldn't use the hotel again in terms of value for money and room size.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-priced hotel, clean & tidy but small & stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Cangarwbach
Reviews.Content: It's a Holiday Inn, so it's average in all respects. The positives: it's less than 100 yards from Russell Square tube station, and if you need extras to supplement your stay there's a Tesco Metro and a Waitrose within spitting distance. It's very clean. It's very quiet, and not a dodgy area. The negatives: the bed's a trampoline, pillows are dodgy. £28!!! for an all day WiFi and TV package - throw it in you cheapskates! The bathroom is abominably small - don't enter when your partner's on the loo, because they'll lose their knees.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4*”
Reviews.Author: pb1642
Reviews.Content: This review falls in two parts. Our first night we experienced the inconsiderate low lifes that sometimes mar what can be a relaxing and long awaited break. Our room in the Holiday Inn left a lot to be desired - it was small, so much so that we had to 'crab' walk to get around the bed. The bathroom was little better with no room to swing the proverbial feline. But as we were visiting London for a show on the first night and dinner at Rules (superb) on the second the accommodations were of a secondary consideration. What really upset me was being woken by a neighbour in the corridor outside our room at 1 in the morning making a 'booty' call. Which the idiot continued to repeat at regular intervals until the 'booty' dutifully arrived at 3 in the morning. Girl you are making the wrong decision the genes just ain't there! Back to the hotel - pretty well positioned and not too far from Covent Garden. It was clean and quiet, apart from the aforementioned neanderthal. That said I don't think it measured up to the 4* standard and appeared to me to be a conversion that sought to maximise the number of rooms rather than guest comfort. The bed was too soft for our liking and there was no bedside cabinet on one side!???? In terms of value for money we reckon it was too expensive for what we were given. That said, we enjoyed our weekend despite the room size and Mr Inconsiderate.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in the area”
Reviews.Author: OldWinedrinker
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small and lacked the comforts I expect at this price. Friendly staff. Location OK but only really handy for British Museum if you're a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Cooperman59
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times over the past few weeks and will be staying again during the next two weeks at least. It's a well kept hotel which looks good inside and out. The standard rooms are adequate in size but no more. The executive rooms are much better with more space plus a couple of complimentary extras. One of the other bonuses is the number of nearby restaurants serving all tastes. One slight issue I have is breakfast. If paid for normally it's about £16 but reduced to £11.50 if vouchers are bought. This is a poor approach and far too expensive when compared to other hotels I have been in. Overall it's good but shame about the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “CHECKIN TAKES TOO LONG”
Reviews.Author: TigerVic
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, but the checkin was too long. We waited about 15 minutes before we got our room keys. Having driven 300 miles into London, all we wanted was to checkin, shower and relax - not linger at the reception counter! To be sure, we were the only ones checking in and there were 3 staff on duty. Seemed like one was a trainee and had to ask the senior for almost every detail. When we called the reception counter from the room, there was no answer! What a let down for a Holiday Inn! Location is great and next to Brunswick Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: vestigium
Reviews.Content: A well located London hotel just yards from Russell Square and within easy walking distance from the British Museum, Covent Garden and Oxford Street. It has the advantage of being on a side street away from the ambulance and police routes (they certainly love their sirens in London!) For those not used to the noise of a big city it's rooms are also double glazed. What it lacks in external appeal or archticeture is made up for on the inside with a good standard of fittings and facilities. Rooms are slightly smaller than its other Holiday Inn neighbours at Regent's Park and Kings Cross but not by much. It's still quite comfortable and the air-con works well. Staff are always helpful and friendly. Buffet beakfast is to a good standard although the restaurant can be busy.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTeddy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from excellent 2 night stay at this hotel. From checking in (allowed us to do this early ) to checking out, the whole experience was excellent. Rooms are a reasonable size, comfortable and immaculately clean. Bathroom had very basic amount of toiletries, but you could request anything you had forgotten if necessary. Food at breakfast and Dinner was very good, and all staff without exception were attentive, cheerful and helpful. This was the same for all of the staff at the hotel,,and a credit to the manager. Tube (Russel Square)about 200 yards away very easy, particularly to and from Kings Cross, but don't be tempted to use the stairs in the tube station unless ultra fit,,, we missed lift and climbed up the spiral staircase OMG thought I'd have stroke!! 175 stairs, nearly killed us.. and a number of others too....lifts only take seconds to come back, should have been more patient!! This is an excellent good value hotel, which I would highly recommend and will definately return soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emily D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and the staff were very firendly and helpful! Our room was very small but this was ok as we were only staying one night and didn't have much luggage, it might have been a bit cramped otherwise. The breakfast in the morning was really good also. The location is fantastic. I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good job. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: EarthTraverse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my daughter and was pretty pleased with the hotel generally. Pleasant and courteous staff. The location is fantastic, so close to Russell Square station, breakfast was great with a large selection of good quality food and the service staff were really good. The concierge was very helpful, making theatre recommendations and assisting with tickets and storing baggage for us was very convenient. I stayed in rooms of different price ranges, due to a problem I made with the booking. The first room, more expensive on the first floor, was really without fault. The second room on the third floor was a bit tired perhaps in the bathroom but it was perfectly fine. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A predictable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: welshgrandad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an excellent location, within easy walking distance of Euston Station and very close to Russell Square tube station on the Piccadilly Line, from where you can very easily get to all the sites and attractions of London. Our "executive" room on the second floor was nice clean and comfortable with all the amenities that you would expect from a Holiday Inn. The breakfast without being exceptional provided all that you need (and more) to set you up for a busy day in the Capital. You could pay considerably more for a hotel nearer to the centre of "town" but this location in Bloomsbury is very good at an affordable price. (Look out for two nights for the price of one offers).

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room away from Service Lifts”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie S
Reviews.Content: I've occasionally stayed here with work and while the hotel is nice enough the room I had was really noisy. My stay was for 4 nights and I kept getting woken up late at night / early hours of the morning with lots of noise and doors banging. Unfortunately I didnt complain till the end of my stay as I was told my room was next to the service lifts which was why it was so noisy - they said they would have moved me if I'd have said something sooner..... silly me! Food and breakfast was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “concierge service was impeccable”
Reviews.Author: sharonStevenage
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our anniversary at the Holiday Inn and were greeted by Gary the most efficient and friendly concierge in London. He gave us a glass of fruit juice as there was a large group waiting to check in. He chatted to us and was very engaging and made us feel very welcome and answered all our questions.Small gestures like this really matter in a corporate hotel chain as first impressions count. The location of the hotel is excellent for walking around the Bloomsbury locale.Lots of bijoux shops and restaurants near by. Will definitely come back again as it is great value and so accesible for transport links.

Reviews.Title: “a great service”
Reviews.Author: amassiad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the holiday Inn bloomsbury for one night during a business trip. While arriving at the hotel, the staff was very welcoming and helpful. I asked for a feather pillow and I got it. The room was spatious and comfortable. It was not noisy. The breakfast was good. The hotel is also well situated, not at the middle of the action, but not too far from attractions (British museum, Soho, Covent Garden ...are at waliking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller95_12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of nights here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We had a great weekend and the plus points were: 1 Easy to get to - very close to Russell Street underground station. 2 Food shops - there's a 24 hour Tesco (opposite RS underground) and a Waitrose (in Brunswick Centre). 3 Other shops - a good selection in the Brunswick Shopping Centre right next to the Holiday Inn. 4 Eating out - lots to choose from. We particularly liked Cosmoba in Cosmo Place off Southampton Row. 5 Camden Market - a half hour walk away, this is a fascinating experience. Hotel was clean, efficient and pleasant. Room was fine, only minor issue, common to many hotels, was loud noise room doors make when shutting. Could also hear lift going up and down, which might be an issue if you were right next to it. Only other noises you could hear were the interesting sounds of other couples enjoying their weekend too... Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Room size if you are paying full price”
Reviews.Author: DenJ33
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but clean and functional (desk etc) although it lacked a fridge and safe. We got a good deal so not a problem but the rooms vary so if you are paying full price check what you are getting. All the staff were friendly and efficient. Russell Square tube is a short walk and even Leicester Square can be reached in 30min if you are fit and active. TIP? If you are planning to be there on a Saturday night check that there is not a function and if so ask for a room at the back… we had people noise outside the front of the Hotel until about 3am : (

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahkitten5
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a Holiday Inn before then you'll know exactly what to expect from this one as the rooms are identical!!!! The location was handy for the tube system. There were a couple of pubs nearby which were also handy!!!! The rooms are basic and clean enough.... although there isn't enough room to "swing a cat"!!!!! The main negative however was the staff on reception.......... not very helpful at all!!! Didn't tell us where our rooms were, how to operate the lifts, what the breakfast situation was or anything about what facilities were actually in the hotel!!!! Tut Tut. But the big plus was the breakfast. There was everything you could possibley want!!! Juice, Yoghurts, Fruit, Cheese & hams, Cereals, breads, baguettes croissaints etc and a lovely cooked hot help-yourself buffet!!!! Lovely Jubbly!!!! however I would recommend getting in early as it gets very busy and a bit stressful for the staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location and Amazing staff !”
Reviews.Author: Bradrakatak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for a night for my friends 50th birthday and I was extremely pleased with our choice of hotel. Firstly we had a warm welcome from Joanna who was efficient and friendly even though it was particularly busy. We left our cases as had got there early and was then offered loads of really helpful advice by Gary who again was just superb. Location of the hotel was great, just minutes from Russell Square tube and within walking distance of the buses to Southbank etc, there are plenty of pubs and restaurants nearby if you wanted to stay local rather than catching transport back. All in all we highly recommend this hotel to anyone :-)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Building But Nice Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DSG01
Reviews.Content: JUst spent 4 nights here on business/pleasure, would normally stay closer to the action in Mayfar but due to high numbers of delagates on business trip booked here. Great deals at the weekend, huge breakfast choice, fantastic staff an "Irish Bar" but also a nice lobby bar as well. Less than 1 minute walk from Tube Station and 7-8 mins to Piccadilly Circus. Not the best rooms in the HI family but not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “theatre break”
Reviews.Author: Edith J
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on the internet as a 2 day break to london for the theatre and siteseeing the room was of a standard double but we were quite surprised how spacious it was we would reccommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for a reasonable priced hotel in london.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Well Run”
Reviews.Author: boronmoron
Reviews.Content: For Tourists like us the location was fabulous. Walking distance to the British Museum at Russell Square and the British Library at St. Pancreas... don't miss them if you are a history buff. Several Pubs on the block with good food and drink, a small mall with a grocery store, restaurants, Starbuck's and money ATM. Clean and efficient with enough British TV satellite channels. The room was compact but adequate and was rather like a Holiday Inn anywhere. We were pleased by how quiet it was ecept for occasional hallway noise. Breakfast was kind of pricey even which some guest discount coupons... but the buffet was good. Transportation was handy with a 1 block walk to Russell Square Underground Station. We were able take the Picadilly Line from Heathrow Airport straight there (about 45 mins). Taxi's are available either in front of the hotel or on the Main St West of the Hotel. This Hotel was a no frills pleasant experience for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: ABologna86
Reviews.Content: Room was bigger than your standard European hotel, although doorway was a bit narrow. Breakfast was good, with plenty of selection of both hot and cold options. Generally good service. Location was great, walkable to theatre district and Covent Garden, and easy on the tube to get anywhere else. There were a few flaws: Wi-fi was expensive, our room was missing the mini-fridge, and check-in was not very smooth (they were training a new woman--maybe that's why?). Overall comfortable, not a bad place to stay, but I would look else where before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced... There are much better hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-in-Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been used for years apparently by my company when we hold events at the Royal College of Surgeons. This will be changing as I cannot get over the lack of value for money in the hotel. The rack rates are absolutely ridiculous, the rooms are bland and unimaginative. A soulless hotel. Try the Hotel Russell around the corner.., it's is worlds apart and the same price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge”
Reviews.Author: travellingmagna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 2012. I was there on business and needed somewhere clean and safe to stay. This was a great hotel. Yes, it's boring, but I wasn't in the hotel except to sleep and bathe, and that's what you want for those things. Will stay there again. Steps from Russell Square tube which will take you directly to LHR. Staff very helpful and friendly. I am female and was travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: Wandertheworld2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the wonderful area of Bloomsbury, where you can find the British Museum and an easy tube stop, Russell Square. There is also St. Pancras, a train station about 3 blocks away, and a small Italian restaurant near the Russell Square tube stop that is absolutely great! The park, nearby, is nice too. That being said, the rooms are very small, beds small, bathrooms are--you guessed it--small too. Staff was great, made reservations, helped with directions and made sure we had a sack breakfast for an early departure. I don't know if I would want to stay here again. Breakfast, included, was ok. I would say that the Bloombury area is excellent, and this is probably one of the most reasonable in that area.

Reviews.Title: “"Very relaxing stay"”
Reviews.Author: JenmaltaSwieqi_Malta
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great!Lovely modern but cosy bedrooms,the first room we were in was very small and the bathroom was tiny ,we didn't have a fridge which we thought was standard to have in every room there was a place for the fridge but no fridge was there,the window couldn't be opened so we felt a bit clausterphobic and the bed was very small.So after 3days we decided to upgrade our room as we had another 7days to go!The executive suite was amazing same decor but larger bed,spacious room and bathroom,fridge and viola ! a window we could open for some fresh air!The staff were excellent,all very helpful and polite ,especially the resteraunt staff .The buffet breakfast was great,the variety of food was very good. A very relaxing stay would go again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ddexter
Reviews.Content: I have not had a lot of luck with Holiday Inn so this hotel was a pleasant surprise. I knew the location was great right near Russell Square tube station (Piccadilly Line is a good train line to be on) and opposite Brunswick Square shopping complex with all it's excellent dining out options. There is also a large tesco there which is handy for family holiday makers. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient; which was a bonus having just flown 14 hours. The room was a complete surprise modern and quite spacious for London with a nice bathroom. It proved to be quiet even though we were on the first floor. The only faults I can pick we're the poor quality pillows that were very nasty and the small bed size which was only a double. Otherwise it was a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: drebir
Reviews.Content: just returned home from a great 3 night stay in London and made even more enjoyable staying at this hotel,,on check in we were given a really nice room on the 6th floor,spacious,clean and peaceful, never heard any noise in the three nights here. Bedroom was very clean and comfy with lovely bathrobes in the bathroom. Had drinks in the bar and service was first class with good prices and not overpriced considering it is a hotel..the bar staff were very friendly and we did not have to ask for our round again,,as the staff were remembering our round (good touch). Morning Breakfast was very good. Really enjoyed my whole stay here,,from check in to check out..Thank You to All

Reviews.Title: “OK, but far from great.”
Reviews.Author: swisstony123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property as part of a bargain January/Olympics deal Holiday Inn ran in December 2011, so certainly can't grumble at the price I paid. Room was clean, bathroom spacious, nice big TV, staff friendly etc, but the property has its flaws and I can't imagine i'll be rushing back. Bed was very soft and not that big at all (probably a 4'6" double). The common radiator pipe runs through all the bedrooms and is exposed, so even if you turn the radiator off, there's still a 3" pipe fully of hot water running nicely along the wall. The radiator pipe made some bizarre banging noises about 4am, waking me up - not good. Very poor sound proofing of the room - the visible gap along the bottom of the door was the obvious indication this would be a problem, so could easily hear conversations in the corridor (we were opposite the lift lobby). Some external noise, especially glass bottles being emptied presumably into a refuse cart quite early in the morning. Anyway, not horrific, but not one of my usual haunts in London and I can't see it becoming one either.

Reviews.Title: “Callaghans Bar, HI Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: Londoner183
Reviews.Content: My partner and I popped in for a drink at the bar Saturday evening and was not impressed with the service. The two women working behind the bar were disinterested in customers to say the least. They carried on their private conversation despite having customers to serve. Perhaps training them to smile would be a start! The decor of the bar left something to be desired it is dark and is in dire need of redecoration. Being regular visitors to Holiday Inns, if Callaghans is a reflection of the hotel, give a wide berth!

Reviews.Title: “Good...for London”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireWindy
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests I have very low expectations for London hotels. The rack rate for this is something like £400 per night - noone pays more than a fraction of that. We went as part of an overnight theatre deal, Positives - Efficiently run, good location for walking (Covent Garden, Oxford Street), Better than usual Holiday Inn buffet breakfast (fresh egg chef but no omelettes), Quiet, Close to Brunswick shopping mall for restaurants and shopping, good concierge service, 100 yds from Russell Square tube, rooms are clean and properly equipped Negatives - Closest tube station is Russell Square which is only on the Piccadilly line and accessible by lift, front desk a little slow, poor bar facilities, asked for adjacent rooms and weren't allocated them

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: smithy_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on December 29th 2011. Rooms are quite small but very clean. The double beds are the smallest we have ever had in any hotel, if we stayed again we would request twin beds for more space (we're 5'2 and 5'6!). Only had drinks in the downstairs bar, prices were fairly high but not as expensive as other hotels in London. A good base for exploring with a supermarket and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BoozyP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a two night break from 29th December on a bogof and arrived at the hotel around midday. Check in is not until 2pm and was going to see if we could leave our bags in the concierge room and go off and check in later. I am a Priority Gold Member and so far I find this is not really recognised at any of the IHG hotels although they have a blue section at the desk anyone was being served there and you had to wait your turn like everyone else! Anyway our room was ready and I arranged breakfast vouchers which reduce the breakfast from £16.95 to £9.50 and kids eat free so we feel that is worth doing when all three are dining at just over £6 per head. The room was as expected, clean, plenty of towels and the pillow option. We were in room 207 overlooking the side street. Slept really well both nights and the breakfast on day 1 was a bit hap hazard and we had actually eaten our food before being offered coffee, it was busy (we went down at 9.30) by just gone 10 alot of the tables had cleared. Day 2 we were down just gone 9 and it was much better. It was a bit noisy outside with bottles being thrown into the skip the 2nd morning but it was at a reasonable time 7.30ish. Is right behind Russell Square station but you are in good walking distance of Covent Garden etc or we went to Holborn and jumped on the tube as was off to London Bridge and that was a bit far to walk! Would stay again at the right rate - mixed nationalities. We did have an evening meal here on our last stay which was fine but the drinks were quite expensive. This time we ate whilst out and about.

Reviews.Title: “gateway in london”
Reviews.Author: Arik R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two minutes walk from russel square tube station ,walking distance to covent garden, britisg museum and russel square. Room size ok and very quiet for night sleep. hotel staff are friendly and very happy to assist the guests. breakfast is ok not superb. I will stay at this hotel again when visiting london

Reviews.Title: “Two out of three ain't bad!”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBelle_10
Reviews.Content: This was the third of three recent Holiday Inn stays, the first of which was appaling. I am pleased to say that this visit was a good one. I've known the hotel for years as I know the area but never stayed here. As others have mentioned it is only 10 minutes walk from Euston and less than 100 metres from Russell Square tube station on the useful Piccadilly line. The Bloomsbury area is a good one, slightly arty from the university crowd and the hotel is opposite the Brunswick Centre with its arthouse cinema, the Renoir and a handy Waitrose supermarket. With some of the best bookshops in London in the area, you can't go wrong on location. We asked for a quiet room which we got and on a high floor. Yes the rooms are small but it is London and you won't get much bigger for this class/price. The room was comfortable and clean, large TV and small but good bathroom. The room and the public areas looked like they have had a refurb recently. Breakfast was typical Holiday Inn with full English - not the best quality ingedients and I would probably think twice about paying for it (£17) if it were not in the room rate. A contributor asked if anybody paid the full rack rate for hotels - I certainly didn't and at just over £90 for one night room with full breakfast for two people I think it was extraordinarily good value for London, especially the busy period between Christmas and New Year. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: fsnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on room only basis as the breakfasts were £16 each. Requested a quiet room and got one overlooking the inner quad but this had the extractor fan noises from the kitchens so moved to a room overlooking the road. Initially this was o.k. but at abour 4.00 a.m. the noise of people shouting in the street could be heard and this went on for some time. The windows don't open and there is just a vent which is closeable but you won't reach if you're small. No mini bar in the room and limited tv channels. (doesn't even have all the freview channels). Clients are mainly foreign nationals as are the staff. Rooms are functional with comfy beds and a choice of pillows. Tea and coffee making facilities. Main problem with this hotel is noise.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great breakfast, basic comfort”
Reviews.Author: lots-of-km
Reviews.Content: Room was basic - almost spartan - but clean, bright, quiet and comfortable. The included breakfast was generous and excellent. I'd wanted to stay in the Russell Square/Southampton Row area, and this hotel offered the best value for money (for London, anyway, which is ridiculously expensive) and a superb location. It's a short block from Russell Square tube station and next to Brunswick Square, a lively pedestrian/retail area. At the right price, I'd definitely stay here again next time I'm in London.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: pamsim
Reviews.Content: Staying for six nights at this hotel was an unforgettable experience. The hotel is very close to russell metro station ( blue line ) . Staff were very friendly. Room was very clean but not big enough. Breakfast was excellent with a big variety of hot and cold dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay On the hotel”
Reviews.Author: okamel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very nice location, but rooms are a bit old with the facilities, A/C in the hotel was OOO for the whole stay, have to stay one night with the door opened to get some air. Management compensated this night, it is a pitty as hotel location is great, should be renovated & looked after well. No variety in food in the morning specially for muslims, as all pork products, have to ask first about breakfast choices before buying this option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: chucknorman77
Reviews.Content: We booked our 1 night stay through Priceline for our annual vist to Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park. Was not sure about location at first as have never stayed in this area before but glad we did. It's only about a 10 minute walk from Euston and as others have said is next door to the Brunswick shopping centre and at the back of the hotel is Russel Square tube on the Piccadilly Line which takes you straight into Theatreland. There is also a Tesco Express opposite the tube and a few pubs and restaurants. We were given a family room with a made up sofa bed so many thanks to the check in staff for that as you cant specify room type on Priceline. We had a room facing the road at the front of the hotel and had no problems with noise during our stay. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, acceptable rooms, helpful concierge, late night food”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Starwood
Reviews.Content: Pricelined 6 rooms here for $150 a night. Excellent central location next to an awesome shopping center, tube, and quite central. Hotel is pleasant, my room was clean, the concierge was helpful, and we got food after 2am. All in all, it was an acceptable stay. Location and price were excellent, the latter from priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1683
Reviews.Content: As a general rule i find London hotels to be cramped and overpriced. This one is overpriced but the standard rooms are a decent size. The staff were friendly and were happy to print some stuff for me in the evening. The room was large with a sofa bed, new flat screen TV and comfy bed. The bathroom and carpets are worn out and could do with a refurb. I had room service in the evening and the food was brilliant, good value for money and nicely cooked and presented. It didn't take too long to be delivered (about 30 minutes). Breakfast was a good standard. As is usual with this type of hotel I struggled to sleep with the thin walls and constantly banging doors along the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “So expensive no where near worth money, rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: samanthalouisehedley
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I hated this hotel so much. It was clean but the staff my god...they need a lesson in smiling they all looked miserable, I'm not surprised to be honest I would be too working there. Over £200 a night and no breakfast included. Toilet broken in room, had to swap rooms total faff on - it was just so overpriced! Couldn't actually believe it. Wouldn't stay there agin unless I fancied paying £7.00 for a pint again!

Reviews.Title: “Will use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: annieh310
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so convenient - easy walk to Covent Garden and many other locations. Tube station handy for other journeys. Pleasant area - near to British Museum. All staff were pleasant and helpful. Room was clean and well equiped. Great breakfasts with plenty of choice. Very good value for money for this location.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend and stay again”
Reviews.Author: mogardner
Reviews.Content: Having read a few negative reviews of this hotel I was not expecting too much, but was more than pleased with the accommodation. Our company's Christmas party was held here and we were allocated some special price rooms if we wanted them including breakfast. As they were cheap I thought I would be given the typical broom cupboard of a single room, but although a bit small there was plenty of room for 1 person. The room was modern, clean and quiet and a lovely comfy bed. All staff were helpful and friendly. The food at our xmas party was of a good standard and well done chefs my vegetarian option of stuffed roast pepper with goats cheese made a welcome change from the normal roast veg in puff pastry normally offered to us non meat eaters, Breakfast was a good selection and despite being very busy the staff were helpful and food plentiful. This hotel is very easy to find just a short stroll from Russel Square underground, i would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sarahmcc5
Reviews.Content: Never stayed in this part of London before & was pleasantly surprised. Hotel within easy walking distance of kings cross & round the corner from Russell square tube. Rooms are clean & pretty basic but what I expected from Holiday Inn. Breakfast was expensive but a good choice(work trip so we didn't pay. If I was paying I would go to one of many cheap breakfast places around the hotel). Great location. All of central London is walkable from hotel but it is a reasonably quiet location. Would def stay again

Reviews.Title: “Does anyone pay the ridiculous full price?”
Reviews.Author: tindella63
Reviews.Content: My company booked me in here and got a reasonable rate - to be honest, it was only worth that reasonable rate. The hotel is very conveniently situated - a little shopping mall next door had a great food fare on Saturday. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was adequate and clean. The food was reasonable, though the dining room is reminiscent of a school canteen. So with all these average comments, how can they charge so much? Paying full tariff I would expect to be served my breakfast at my table, not queue and wait for the eggs to be fried. I suppose my views are coloured by half a dozen small children being allowed to run round and round in reception while their adult "minder" allowed it. No-one on the hotel staff attempted to remonstrate - it certainly lowered the tone.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy small rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: OrvistheDog
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say the reception staff were excellent and deserve praise. The real problem is with the rooms. I was allocated what I can only call a cupboard instead of a room. A photo is below. Simply put the room was not good enough and way below the standard of other HI properties in London. Most of the staff tried but could not remedy the situation. They swapped rooms for me on the second night but to a similar cupboard-like room but this time it was more recently decorated. This one was not so dark and looked into the street rather than directly into someone else's office. The phone did not work and amenities were missing. I have stayed in this hotel previously in an acceptable room but this stay was disappointing and other similar HI properties in London do much better for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: discerning60
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this hotel recently. Absolutely nothing wrong with it, but no atmosphere, very bland. Breakfast fine, had better and had worse.Having said that when you are in London the hotel is usually only for sleeping in so this hotel was more than adequate for that. A good location. about 15 mins walk from Covent Garden. 2 mins from underground. 2 mins from British Library. Some good local pubs Cross Keys and Museum are just 2. Nice little arcade with some good shops at the back of the hotel. (Hobbs, Fcuk, Gap kids, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jw290170
Reviews.Content: I have a gold card and thought this would get me a slight upgrade Unfortunatly I was put in a box room opposite the elevator which kept me awake all night Carpet in the room was no clean

Reviews.Title: “well located and eager to please”
Reviews.Author: Lazycanuck
Reviews.Content: Entering room 550, I noticed that the shade had been removed from a reading light and placed on a bedside table. I found out why when I determined that the light itself did not work. I also thought the room excessively warm and soon discovered that adjusting the temperature control brought no relief. When I reported these problems, however, they were put right with impressive efficiency. A maintenance man quickly fixed the temperature problem just by going off and flipping a circuit breaker somewhere, and within a day he also had repaired the light fixture. Whenever I spoke to the people at the front desk about these and other matters, I was impressed by their evident eagerness to please. Aside from the initial glitsches, my room was just what I would expect at a Holiday Inn: nothing special about it, but nothing much wrong with it either. The water pressure in the shower was weak, but everything was clean and the beds quite comfortable. At first I was disappointed that my window just faced another wing of the hotel, but later I came to view it as a blessing because I heard absolutely no outside noise during the night. As many reviewers point out, the best thing about this hotel is its unbeatable location, a short stroll from the tube direct to Heathrow and right next door to a shopping centre containing a Waitrose supermarket. Rather than pay for an expensive hotel breakfast, I just walked over to Waitrose the night before and picked up some fruit and scotch eggs. I also avoided the hotel's internet charges just by walking half a block up Marchmont Street to a little place where half an hour on a computer cost only a pound.

Reviews.Title: “To remedy unfair wrongs!”
Reviews.Author: dennymenny
Reviews.Content: Certain of the reviews of this hotel worried me when I booked a standard double room for last weeekend - they described unpleasant experiences with staff and inferior quality accomodation; happily this was not the experience of my wife and myself. The staff at both reception and in the dining room were courteous, friendly and thoroughly professional in their duties - nothing was too much trouble and the standard of service was exemplary. Our room was spotlessly clean and well presented- perfectly suitable for a weekend break. We only took breakfast in the hotel but this, too, was exceptional- way beyond our accustomed experience in London hotels recently. A vast and impressive choice of hot and cold buffet items was available and the dining room staff were absolutely splendid- attentive and eager to please. I will certainly be using this hotel again and I warmly commend it to others wanting a comfortable and well located base for exploring central London and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Izzet Z
Reviews.Content: Location is superb. Only 200 metres from the Russell Square tube station, making it easy to go anywhere you like in London. I stayed in a double room as one person and it was okey, but if two people were to stay, it will feel crowded. There is no mini-fridge which can be a convenience sometimes. The shower was easy to operate unlike some hotel showers. Note that there are no slippers provided in the room. Overall, it was very clean. I am likely to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean corporate stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Poppie11
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Saturday night at the Holiday Inn, Bloomsbury as even though we live in West London we wanted to be central to enjoy some Soho jazz and dancing. I got this hotel via Lastminute Top Secret hotels for a reasonable £120 and upgraded for a few quid more to an executive room - worth every penny! Large room, twin beds, enormous shower, robes and a few goodies included and all very comfortable. Very quiet and easy to get to around on buses(91 to Trafalgar Square). No breakfast included but Patisserie Valerie around the corner! Good, clean corporate hotel, nothing extraordinary but I rated it very good instead of average as it wasn't bad at all! Bloomsbury is a great area and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Only positive was location”
Reviews.Author: stuartb1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and was a little disappointed with the place. The room was very small, it was also very very tired looking. The staff at reception where useless. Bar next to hotel was very scruffy and noisey. It was close to both the tube station and a shopping centre, but those are the only 2 redeeming features. I would not stay here again unless I really had to.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: jemsmith24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was lovely. It is a stones throw away from Russell square tube station and 10 minutes walk away from covent garden. We stayed in a standard double room which was small but very clean and comfortable. The only thing i would complain about is the breakfast is rather expensive at £16.95 per person but if you book it at reception it was abit cheaper. We also stayed here on an offer so we got it abit cheaper, it would of been too expensive without this offer.Overall our stay was very pleasant and we wouldnt hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base if you are jumping on/off a train at King's Cross or Euston.”
Reviews.Author: Harry'sDadScotland
Reviews.Content: Perfect for simple base if using King's cross or Euston. My meeting was in the conference rooms in the hotel. Easliy walkable to King's Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for West End”
Reviews.Author: zippymonkey
Reviews.Content: A standard, comfortable chain hotel, extremely well located right next to Russell Square tube and the Brunswick Centre for shops and restaurants. An easy walk into the West End and also to Euston, Kings Cross, St Pancras. Staff efficient, rooms compact but clean, didn't take breakfast, but went to a nearby cafe. Booked as a "mystery" hotel on Last Minute, hence was very good value, and would book again for a London trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Break”
Reviews.Author: rogshe
Reviews.Content: For a high volume busy London hotel the Holiday Inn at Bloomsbury was a great find. Not that it was hidden just that we have tried several London hotels for a short break and this stood out a long way. We booked through Super Breaks and as usual the hotel expected us and reception was calm and efficient despite a large group of verbal Russians giving them a hard time. The room was bright, airy and very clean with an option on pillows, which was a nice touch. All the usual and necessary bathroom accessories were there and the bathroom was spotless. A reception request for extra milk was instantly dealt with so plenty of tea and coffee for weary travellers was no problem. Our package was for two nights with the first nights evening meal included. The meal was excellent and the menu plentiful and varied, and the pricing and specials clearly explained to us. Service was prompt and friendly. The food was very good and reasonable priced for the centre of London. We were planning to eat out on our second night but the restaurant was so good we ate there the second night too. The hotel review can’t leave out the concierge, a young man called Gary, whose whole attitude was “can do”. Exceptional service in a quiet and efficient manor, with the enviable ability to deal with several customers at once. Good hotel, great service all round highly recommendable for London breaks.

Reviews.Title: “You will get on better if your first language is not English!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Burge
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a few times in the past I feel that a review is needed after yet another stay where so much goes wrong when the staff cannot understand English. Staying on business you do not always want to eat on your own in the restaurant so I called for room service. The guy on the other end of the telephone could not understand a single word, and eventually after me having to go to the restaurant to order, my food arrived nearly two hours late and wrong. This is the 3rd time in this hotel this has happend. Not just slightly wrong but completely. The time before this stay they had no chicken, steaks or fish at all and I had to eat either a curry or a burger. Not good at all. The hotel is nice and the food when you get some is nice also, but watch out and make things very clear.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel great location...”
Reviews.Author: new_york_paris
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Was here for the accommodations as well as a trade fair in May. All very well done and will return for the same next year. near the tube, Russell Square and the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirelassie13
Reviews.Content: You know how it is...you book a hotel because of how close it is to your meeting/interview/appointment and then you get there and there is nothing around you. So you have to eat and stay in the hotel, or add to the cost by walking or getting a cab somewhere. Well this hotel is very close to the Brunswick centre where there are shops and restaurants within 1 minutes walk. It is also 2 minutes walk from the underground station, and there is a barclaycard bike park in front of the underground station. Perfect Location. The hotel is very clean and modern. My room was small, and the bathroom was also very small, but it had everything I needed, and had one of the comfiest beds in any hotel room. The pillow menu also confused me, but hey I am blonde! Check in and out was wonderful, and the staff are so very obliging. The place is very very clean. There is a pub onsite but I didn't use it. All in all a great stay, and I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect....oh and a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bigmacro
Reviews.Content: Room as expected. Comfy beds and I always like holiday inn choice of soft or hard pillows. Bath a bit narrow....especially having indulged in huge buffet breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “Time and Time again meets and exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller77_7
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel, stayed several times and never had a problem. Great location for business and pleasure. Staff are always friendly and remember me as a return guest which is nice...

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: sue777
Reviews.Content: This is always our first choice when staying in London due to the excellent location (a few mins walk from Euston and 2 mins from the underground) - car park next door, and it's not too far to walk into London either! We always find that it is good value for money - the rooms are spotless, beds and pillows very comfy, quiet rooms with everything you could need. The staff are very helpful and attentive - nothing is too much trouble and the food is everything you could want and more! We had an executive room this time - chocolates and pack of biscuits very appreciated!! Can't recommend this hotel enough for London weekends away - the manager must definitely be doing something right here!

Reviews.Title: “stayed here every week for 8 months”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Platinum PC member, I stayed here practically every week from January to August 2011. I really enjoyed my time at this hotel, the rooms are a fair enough size for central London (so not huge - but then again larger than a lot of similarly priced places.) All the rooms have been decorated recently and are clean and smart. The 6th floor rooms are particularly good, I think better than the 1st floor executive rooms. The staff at this hotel were what really made my time there special. Keith the concierge (who, I found out from another long-time visitor has been there for a long time) is the best concierge I've encountered in 15 years on the road. Keith if you read this, thanks! Room Service was good quality and excellent service too, I can think of 2 occasions in probably 75 orders when there was a problem, and both times everything was resolved quickly and efficiently. Book early, as prices shoot up at short notice, but with good reason - for people coming down from the North by train this is a perfectly located hotel between KX/Euston and the West End too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel not a good as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Col2362
Reviews.Content: Yes we have stayed here a couple of times before and for a London hotel this is very good for the money. It's a fantastic location with Russel square tube 2 mins away and Brunswick shopping square also 2 mins away with some nice shops and restaurants. We were heading back to London to celebrate a special birthday for my husband. We had emailed the hotel prior as we had stayed before and prefered a room on the inner side of the hotel. When we arrived they had no trace of our requirements however they did their best and gave us a room on the inner of the hotel. Although i note the windows have now been changed to double glassing so noise in the rooms will be less of an issue. We went to our room and couldn't believe as we opened the door. It was like opening a cupboard with a double bed and desk pushed in. At one side of the bed you couldn't even get in or out of for the wall, plus no bath only a shower. We had never had a room like this on previous visits and headed straight back down to reception. We were allocated another room, headed back up in the lift and guess what exactly the same. Our hearts sank. We were there for a special occassion and this was just not what we expected. After few minutes discussion we headed back down to reception. We explained we had stayed numerous times and rooms had always been larger etc. Reception explained that they were standard rooms and they now offered larger rooms on an executive rate and offered us one of these for an additional fee! We asked to have a look at one first and yes when they were much larger, had full bathroom, bathrobes etc etc. We negotiated the price and settled on one of these. We had an enjoyable stay, granted you are not in the hotel for long periods when in ondon but for the time that you are it is nice to feel comfortable. Breakfast were acceptable and staff always pleasant. The location is what really sells this hotel and we will be mindful of the room situation if we were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: JA_Kennedy_11
Reviews.Content: Because of the good location just 2 minutes walk from the Russel Square tube station it's very quick and easy to get to the theatre district. Or one can walk to the Covent Garden area in about 25 minutes. The British Museum is a 5 minute walk away and it's free and amazing. The hotel is clean. The sheets are very white. The breakfast was included in the package we bought. It is o.k. We didn't take the sausages/bacon etc. but others did with gusto. The fresh-fried eggs were really too runny on just one of the 6 days we were there. The bread was fresh. There was fresh melon balls and orange slices. The juices seemed a little watery. The coffee was bitter, like every other place in London except for the Italian restaurants. We were assigned a family room with double bed and a pull out couch. I hurt my back trying to pull out the couch. At the front desk, we were informed that that couch doesn't work and we would be upgraded to an executive suite. Yeah! The staff couldn't get the computer to agree. Boo! We were given another family room and the pull out couch bed was unusable: a matress so thin that you could feel each spring. The staff argued that that was what we ordered. I ignored the obvious counter-argument that we didn't order an unusable bed and instead asked them what they could do for us. They immediately suggested that they send up several duvets to pad the mattress. They've obviously had had this complaint before. This worked well. The heating/cooling instructions were given to us incorrectly and they had to send someone up. He was very helpful. The TV kept showing a big black bar saying "Msg" but we had no messages. The staff instructions didn't work. They sent up a very pleasant guy who couldn't help. They resolved the issue the next day. The rooms are very small and currently in need of a "spruce up": e.g. the furniture is chipped, but it is clean. I think it was very expensive for what we got and it is definately NOT 4 STAR. The concierge is a delight and very helpful. For 40 pounds and a "sign up" we got the room for an extra 6 hours for a late check out at 6 pm. This was worth it for us because we had a late evening flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: bertiekerr
Reviews.Content: We booked in here as my wife had an exam the next day in Bloomsbury and we didn't want to face public transport that day. We also booked it through lastminute.com's secret hotels. It was described as 4 star. We booked a double room but on arrival my wife was told only twins were available. Then the room didn't have a mini-fridge as expected on the hotel details. The rooms are standard business hotel type rooms. Also the beds were very soft. The location is convenient and the brunswick centre nearby is full of chain restaurants and a huge waitrose. It's also walking distance to theatre land. The room rate was quite reasonabel considering it was London but not quite up to what we had anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Everytime I go for dinner, I wait and wait!”
Reviews.Author: PoppyNorfolk_England
Reviews.Content: My colleagues were staying at this hotel and i visited them to have a drink in the bar and then dinner. The bar service was fine: the waiter came to our seats for our orders and did not muddle up who paid for what. We went into the restaurant for dinner at 7.45. It was not full, maybe another 15 or so people apart from my 4 colleagues and myself. We did get our menus quickly.....but that was the only thing that did go quickly the whole night......20 mins before they took our orders, a wait of 30 for the starters, waited again to have plates etc removed and a further wait of 45 mins before the mains were served. I decided not to have coffee or desert but did have to wait a further 15 mins for my bill. The food was fine, the service very slow; no-one explained why the wait was so long.....it was hard to find a waiter. This is the third such occasion that I have the same experience at the same hotel this year. Beware if you want to do anything else during the evening- if you eat here, you won't have time for it!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel i ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: barakdf
Reviews.Content: best bed , great big LG LCD tv , great housekeeping and big bath , 1 mintue walk to the under ground and 1 mintue walk to a shoping centre , helpfull and friendly staff , every day i got 2 water bottles and a kit kat snack

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: I would definately return to this hotel. Very clean and bright with a nice 'pub' style bar area. Excellent location witrh nice shopping centre nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a London visit”
Reviews.Author: davefoster11
Reviews.Content: This is a very typical Holiday Inn hotel with recently refurbished rooms that were pleasant and very clean. Staff are helpful and friendly with efficient check-in and check-out.It is a great location for getting arond London and also benefits from having an excellent pub just across the road," The Marquiss de Cornwallis". They also have their own bar next to the hotel which is handy if not particularly wonderful. The restaurant food is fairly good but not remarkable and is very much what I would expect from a hotel restaurant. Well worth a visit and it remains one of my top choices for a London hotel. The only downside for this hotel is the same as all other Holliday Inns, they demand payment for access to the inhouse WiFi. One day hopefully they will realise that this is free with a £1 burger at McDonalds and so should be free at all good hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenmaestro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times in the past year and thought it was about time I wrote a review. It's a purpose built building so I would imagine that 90% of the rooms are the same size and layout. It has a new bright lobby and adjacent busy bar and restaurant. Rooms are standard Holiday Inn equipped though for some weird reason not all have safes. Why a refurbished hotel thinks it's OK not to put safes in all rooms is beyond me. The 'executive' rooms on the first floor have stylish wooden sliding shutters - they look pretty but be aware that the black out ALL hint of light so if you are a heavy sleeper make sure you set good alarms if you need to be up! The standard rooms are smaller than perhaps average but well equipped and standard Holiday Inn fair. I have found that here and at several other HI's the 'choice of pillow' concept doesn't really work as I get the impression that the maids just 'guess' which is firm or soft (as I can't tell either!) and just put the label on what the think is best! I haven't found any noise problem in any of the rooms that I have stayed in. For me the best thing about the hotel is the location - five minutes walk (if that) from Russell Square tube, 15 minutes from St Pancras or Euston and adjacent to the now fabulous (once horrid) Brunswick Centre with Waitrose, Tesco Metro and a dozen or more excellent eateries for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Add to that wonderful Marchmont Street with real 'local' shops, the city's only Gay/Lesbian book shop and a host of ethnic restaurants and you have just about the perfect location in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Will come back”
Reviews.Author: ygotlie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is based about 50 meters from Russell Square station. There's a small shopping center next to it (we noticed it on the day we left). We stayed on the standard double room which was kinda small. The window faced the inner yard of the hotel which was gravel with some a/c engines. That is not a nice view. The room was very clean. We had hot water all day long. The lobby is big. The staff is very helpful and smile all the time. The breakfast is excellent. It's buffet and the quality is good. We will return but will order a higher standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkR79
Reviews.Content: Looks recently refurbished rooms were a good size with LCD tv. Clean and well looked after. Nice bathroom. Room overlooking centre of hotel was very quiet. Only thing letting it down is you have to pay for wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location......TINY room :(”
Reviews.Author: swedishstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few Holiday Inn Expresses so was expecting a higher standard for the money..........was a little disappointed if truth be told. Room was immaculately clean. Good facilities, nicely decorated. However the Double Room I had booked was too small for words as was the Bathroom. Had to close the bathroom door to access the Shower. And after my Half Marathon I was looking forward to a Bath I could lie down in! To add insult the double bed didn't seem large enough to be a double. On a positive the Hotel was beautifully clean, seconds away from Russell Square Tube and service good. Must admit though I do prefer the Holiday Inn Express Brand and would recommend over the higher branded version. Especially with the complimentary breakfast. Word of advice........join their Priority Club Members for free. I joined when I stayed in Cheltenham and within a week I had a 2 for 1 night offer for any hotel within the Group. Fab!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accessible room, lovely staff - prices are a bit steep!”
Reviews.Author: BlackVanDyke
Reviews.Content: I am a wheelchair user and need to use a hoist to get out of my chair and into bed as my joints are too fragile for any other method of transferring. Normally, this means paying hundreds and hundreds of pounds to hire a hoist from an assistive technology company and having it delivered - but not at the H. Inn Bloomsbury! They are trailblazers; they have installed ceiling-track hoists in two of their accessible rooms in this hotel. This makes it one of only two hotels in London (the other is also an IHG hotel but much more expensive) that I can stay at without having to hire additional equipment - for this I would return even if I were greeted at check-in by a giant, talking cockroach - it really is worth the world, to be able to book into and stay at a hotel like a typical guest without having the bill for the trip pretty much doubled by equipment hire costs. And as it is, no cockroaches, talking or not - this is a spotless, impeccable hotel in a slightly awkward and dated building which is very much made the most of. Despite having a very busy pub downstairs and (I think?) a nightclub across the square I didn't hear a peep and slept extremely well. The accessible room I stayed in was generously proportioned and the bathroom spacious (also provided with a hoist!) well thought-out, although crying out for a wheel-in shower - that would be the final touch that really would make the Holiday Inn the absolute perfect hotel for me. The crowning glory for the severely disabled traveller is the complimentary small room with through door provided for a Personal Care Assistant - I've never come across this in another hotel and it was absolutely fantastic - actually a better setup than what I have in my own specially-designed house! Breakfast was perfectly nice, particularly the mini pastries which were still warm and frankly heavenly, but not even remotely worth the cost - they'd have to encrust it all in gold leaf or something... go for it as a special treat maybe, but otherwise pop round the corner and get something from Waitrose. Omitting breakfast makes the stay rather better value for money than it would otherwise, much though I miss the buffet. The staff are unfailingly friendly and attentive - unusual in such a big hotel. Having returned a few times I'm recognised now, which is really lovely. Makes a big hotel in a big city feel much smaller. Honourable mention to the night-time duty manager who helped us to sort out a 2am fluid spillage without so much as blinking, despite the fact that I was on the bed while it was being changed and unable to get out again - above and beyond the call of duty, that. These days I have to sleep in a special bed which I hire from the above-mentioned assistive tech company - fore-warn the hotel and by the time you check in the bed's been delivered, set up by the delivery driver and then made up impeccably by housekeeping. It's quite something to have to bring your own bed with and STILL feel like you present no additional trouble to the staff! This is now the only place I will stay in London. Location's brilliant, staff brilliant, looking forward to my next visit already.

Reviews.Title: “A Firm Favourite”
Reviews.Author: martinshrimper
