Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and have always enjoyed every visit. The reception area is bright and clean and the reception staff are excellent, welcoming,efficient and friendly. I always get recognised as a Platinum Priority Club Member. I like the lounge area, the service is faultless and the food on offer excellent. The executive rooms have large flat screen tv's, and are well appointed. Breakfast is a buffet and is of good quality. This is a good hotel to stay at in London and I would recommend it. Do not however just turn up and pay the rack rate which is eye watering

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff but small room”
Reviews.Author: filboy2028
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on business. Clean and sharp decoration, with friendly staff. London size room, but you expect that really. Breakfast was tasty with efficient staff to ensure you didn't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Joke of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smiffle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. It looks nothing like the picture and it's a disgrace for what you pay. The room clogged up after 3 days of staying there which resulted in me having to miss a full days work moving all my luggage and speaking to the ignorant staff on the front desk. It then takes me ages to wait to check out so I have to fast track check out to catch my train. No taxi service was offered for the inconvenience of the bathroom situation. Their way of apologising for the toilet clogging up was offering us a new room, no meal wine nothing. I then come home to look at my online banking and they've taken £10 from my account. When I called up they have bad manners and disregard my call, telling me to call back at 10am. I found this added stress to a stressful trip I was already having. I chose to hotel as it was close to the Freemasons Hall. I know now I'd rather spent the money on train, taxi or tube fairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great staff”
Reviews.Author: taboyd715
Reviews.Content: I have never been to London before and was only going to be there for a couple of days and did not know my way around. The hotel is located very close to the tube station and only took a couple of minutes to walk. The staff was very friendly and did a great job on recommending places to go and the best way to see the city. I look forward to coming back to London soon and will stay with them when I do so....

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: littlevMedway
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear one night, clean but small room, polite helpful staff, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MistyDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night for a trip to see Rock of Ages at Shaftesbury Theatre (Which was fantastic) Stayed in room 201 which was small, but I requested a quiet room and it was lovely and quiet. Bar next door was nice but took a quite a while for food to come, we only ordered 2 portions of chips and it was pretty empty in the bar, when the food did eventually arrive it was very nice. The best thing about the hotel is it's location, with Russell Square tube literally minutes away. Would stay here again and would reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: eskimojosie
Reviews.Content: Recently used the Bloomsbury Holiday Inn as a bolt hole in London. My partner and I checked in and out of the hotel three times over two weeks, while flitting around the US and Europe. The staff there were always friendly and professional. The rooms comfortable and clean, the restaurant great for a convenient breakfast (but there are plenty of eateries around the area for breakfast, lunch and dinner choices) and it cannot be beaten for it's fantastic location, just steps away from Russell Square Station on the Piccadilly Line. The rooms are standard and some are a little small, however when we asked for a bigger room on our last stay we were swapped to a much bigger room with no argument or grumble from the staff. We will be staying again on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ScooterJuly
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Holiday Inn now for a number of years and the team there are great - they are friendly, they always try to accommodate my needs and they are the reason I keep going back there rather than to another Holiday Inn. The rooms are OK - standard rooms are small but have what you need. Business rooms are great and if you get the chance for an executive room they are really comfortable. If you want to stay somewhere near Holborn and Russell Square that is close to the tube, near shops (there is a shopping centre with lots of restaurants and a Waitrose just across the road) where the team are lovely then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Good Time”
Reviews.Author: SmileUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011 a hotel very close to the British Museum in fact walking distance. With a husband who is in a wheelchair an accessible room was required but when we got there the bathroom had a bath with handrails and no wheel in shower a hoist could be obtained for those wishing to use it. Luckily hubby managed to be supported by me to get in the bath. A wheel in shower is a must for wheelchair users. The hotel room was very nice and clean and the bed so big I had to phone my husband to see if he was still in it .. Lovely :) and the bathroom very spacious. We would stay again if the showers were installed. Across the road from the hotel is a complex which had many restaurants and food outlets but we had a drink or 2 in the attached Irish pub Callaghans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: 50ish_Mom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights at the beginning of a 10 day stay in England. The hotel is a block from the tube stop, and a few blocks from the British Museum and British Library. The concierge recommended some great nearby restaurants. (The desk staff was useless in that regard.) Large, comfortable room. Fantastic breakfast with some of the best croisants I've had outside of France! Very pricey WiFi -- we didn't bother but went down the block to an internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Quite central and reasonable price (on campaign)”
Reviews.Author: besj62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my daughters (18 and 21 years old). We had booked the hotel to see the Miró exhibition at Tate Modern and to do some shopping. It fitted us quite well, rooms were clean and not to worn. All right.

Reviews.Title: “4-star location, 3-star rooms, 2-star bathrooms, 0-star Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Aeonweir
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near and convenient to major attractions in the centre of London. Rooms are fine though not terribly huge, they are however reliably quiet and clean. For London hotels, "average" is already good. The staff are courteous and very helpful. The bathrooms were however quite cramped and after having a look I asked my sister to stay in the room along with my mother (75yo) for fear that getting in-out of the bathtub could be tricky for her. There is no free Wifi and to me, any hotel which does not provide some form of free access for guests is out of touch with reality. The pub across the road from the entrance has excellent well priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: Oliver002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely tired, breakfast is terrible and staff are completely disengaged. I overheard staff arguing with guests on every occassion I went to the area - not good!

Reviews.Title: “Back Again and Inn Helped Resolve Our Problem”
Reviews.Author: HEC140
Reviews.Content: We returned this September and found hotel even more helpful. A serious problem had developed with retrieving luggage from car rental foul-up in Glagow. The two concierges were very solicitous assisting us getting golf clubs etc from rental car we had to leave behind in Scotland. Service was excellent from front desk, maids, wait staff. Even the manager met with us. A very well run hotel. Quite location at Russell Square tube station allows one to take the Picadilly Line right to Heathrow, saving about 50 pounds for two. What a deal! And West End theater is 2-3 stops away. We have stayed here each trip for at least 15 years. It has all one wants in a reasonably priced Lundon hotel. Take the breakfast option, since it is a complete morning meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ns0117
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay here. The hotel is in a great location, just a few mins walk from Russell Square tube and in an area which felt very safe. Lots of pubs and restaurants nearby so no need to eat in the hotel. I wouldn't recommend the Irish pub attached to the hotel as there is a much better one over the road. The room was clean and well decorated, but small even by London standards. We were on the 5th floor but still had some outside noise, but then you don't expect peace and quiet in London. Reception was well staffed and we never had to wait. They were knowledgable about the local area which is rare sometimes. You had to swipe your room key in the lift to get it to work which was good added security. Overall we'd definitely stay here again given the good price (we found it for just under £100 per night), cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: StvBentos
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through lastminute.com as was spending the weekend in London for our anniversary - taking in a show (Rock of Ages, awesome!) and some great food. The hotel from the outside wasn't very appealing but location wise was a 15 minute wals from Oxford Street, Covent Garden etc. The room was very small for the price (and a supposed 4* hotel) and fairly comfortable. Despite being on the 5th floor, there was still quite a bit of noise coming through from outside late into the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trickytwo
Reviews.Content: This is a good standard hotel within walking distance of Euston Station main line and a few minutes from the Underground at Russell Square. The Standard Room we had was very clean but bit smaller than normal for a Holiday Inn as was the bathroom, which did have a bath. The area is close to the British Museum and London Universities we were able to walk to Covent Garden in under half an hour

Reviews.Title: “wont be back”
Reviews.Author: Brenda D
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the holiday inn for three family birthdays, and we were not happy no english speaking staff and very unhelpful on reception we did have a meal the first night and our waitress was pleasent so that was something, i thought the fabrics in the rooms need updating wont go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent London base - No reason to book anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: RubyMaier
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on business several times over the past few years and I have no reason to book anywhere else when on business in London, even compared to others in their group. It's a straight forward city centre hotel, with friendly helpful staff and clean rooms. Handy location for tube and good local shops if you have forgotten anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Standard Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: dav555
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Holiday Inn London Bloomsbury several times on business. The hotel is your typical Holiday Inn, with a very good bar/pub on the ground floor. Most of the rooms are the usual holiday inn standard and perfectly acceptable although I had to insist on changing rooms as on a recent visit I was allocated a very small room. Check in can be a little slow particularly at peak times. The hotel is in a good location, 5 minutes from Russell Square tube. About 2 minutes from the hotel is the Brubswick centre, a small shopping area, mostly comprising of a Waitrose (food supermarket) and lots of places to eat, Nandos, Carluccios, Starbucks etc There are 2 Holiday Inns with Bloomsbury in the title, if getting a taxi, make sure you specify the correct one. London Bloomsbury is on Coram Street, the other one is Holiday Inn Kings Cross, Bloomsbury (Kings Cross Road). This review is for Coram street, which in my opinion is the better. The hotel has it's own pub which is very nice and well worth a quick drink. It's a good base to explore from and well located, I’d recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristina1606
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a twin double smoking room for four days, and arrived to a small room with a terrible smell. It wasn't possible to open the windows, so we wouldn't even unpack our suitcases in fear of the smell sticking to our clothes. As I like to have a couple of sigarettes by the (open) window in evenings, this was all quite unbearable. I asked reception if there was any chance for us changing to a non-smoking room, and was told that we could have a new room the next morning. We were even offered an upgrade to an executive room. So the next morning I went down to reception for the room switch, and the receptionist on duty could not find any changes or notes regarding our change. All she could do was put us in an available room, an executive room, but we would have to pay an extra GBP 15 per night for this. I tried explaining that the receptionist i spoke to the previous night offered this upgrade as a courtesty, but then I was told I had misunderstood. Well, I didn't. The executive room was as you would expect an ordinary room in a four star hotel would be like. Even the window, in this non-smoking room, did open! The new room also had a minibar, the old one did not. The cost of using the wifi was high, but across the street you can use the wifi in the shopping centre for free. On our last day, the maid knocked on our door and tried to enter at 9 in the morning. Twice. Check-out wasn't until 12. All in all, this is a 3* hotel at most, considering the rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect London base!”
Reviews.Author: Holidays635
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at the end of April when we visited London for the Royal Wedding. Absolutely no complaints! Delicious breakfast, sausage, bacon, fried and scrambled eggs, hash browns, mushrooms, tomatoes etc, cereals, juices, fruit, yoghurts, pain au chocolat, croissants available! So much choice!! Tea and coffee served throughout. Rooms very nice, spacious, light, well equipt maintained. Choice of pillows to suit you, tea and coffee facilities, seating area. Cleaned to a high standard daily. Bar and dining area very modern and nice. Reception area modern, helpful, professional staff. We used the lower level carpark which was reasonably prices by London prices. About a minute walk for Russell Square tube station so good links to the rest of the city. Highly recommended for a high standard hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Mazmarie
Reviews.Content: Right in the thick pf everything so if you dont want to venture out at night there is plenty on doorstep

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqs44
Reviews.Content: Bought as a package via a newspaper offer with theatre tickets and the hotel exceeded all expectations. Plus after seeing the charges on the reception wall for rooms we really got a bargain. We only stayed one night and arrived early (11am) to see if we could drop off the bag so we could do some sightseeing before our Theatre time and we were booked into our room there and then so we could drop off our luggage. Staff very friendly polite and helpfull. Room just what we needed and not too noisy. The bed was very comfortable and everything in the room clean and tidy. Breakfast was included and you could literally eat and drink as much as you wanted with a varied and plentiful choice to be had. Our only gripe was you had to insert your room card everytime you used the lift to go up, but I suppose this was for extra security.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience will go back and stay here”
Reviews.Author: somu97
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. pricewise the rates are steep and could be brought down. room fridge should be provided in all rooms, as some do and some dont.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite London hotel”
Reviews.Author: toxKent
Reviews.Content: When spending a weekend in London, my partner and I usually stay at the Intercontinental Park Lane, but decided to give this hotel a go for our 8th Anniversary. I booked the room online, and then e-mailed Elena - the Front Desk Manager. She noted my room location preferences and a 4pm check out request, and said she would do her best to honour them, subject to availability. The first thing that impressed us was the hotel's amazing location - a stone's throw from Russell Square tube station, local bus routes, St Pancras station, the Brunswick (shopping) centre and several nice restaurants. Staff were very polite and efficient from check in to check out, the Executive Bedroom was very well equipped (37" TV and channel choice especially), the bed was comfortable, air conditioning was very effective and the shower powerful (very unusual on a top floor of a hotel). We didn't use the room service, bar/pub, restaurant or fitness facilities - so cannot comment on these. I'd like to thank Elena for seeing to our requests, and her team for their efforts in making our Anniversary weekend very enjoyable and stress-free. We will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cata C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to spend the weekend to London and we were surprised of that hotel. Even was a bit expensive, it was worth it. The rooms are really cleaned and looked renewed. The location was fantastic and the staff was really nice, specially people in the bar, restaurant and reception, where we were welcomed by a young spanish lady who was really nice with us and specially to Gary (the consierge) who helped us with the theatre tickets and recommended us a really nice restaurant around the area. Thanks a lot. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kissfreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were intending to go the (cancelled) England friendly football match. locationally very good the hotel is a stone's throw from Russell Square tube station with central London in very easy reach. Our room was for a family and it was a tight squeeze with the sofa bed down: my wife badly bashed her toe within 5 minutes of arrival and for a family with small children there would be little space for them to move around. Fortunately we wanted to be out and about rather than in the room so it was not so much of an issue for us. Whilst the room had air con this was pretty noisy to have on at full pelt so we didn't have it on overnight but this did mean that the room got quite warm as the windows do not open at all. Breakfast was great and we had no problems getting straight in each day we were there. The staff were all very welcoming and it was nice that the serving staff remembered us from the previous day on the second morning; a great touch by them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel location - loyal customers mean nothing to them though”
Reviews.Author: zcwm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good hotel and staff are perfectly pleasant however they have no idea how to look after loyal customers to the brand. Platinum member and despite a room upgrade entitlement the first room was actually a downgrade from the one booked/paid for. The next room was the room actually booked and I overheard paid upgrades being offered to other customers. If it were not so convenient I would stay elsewhere as when in the brand 7/7 nights this week I do expect to be looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Best disabled rooms we have ever found in the UK or abroad”
Reviews.Author: JacquieRose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband, disabled son and his carer. The disabled room and bathroom were spacious and well thought out and the carer's room was accessed via an inter connecting door. This room again was spacious. The reception staff were extremely helpful particularly when I panicked because I had left my son's sling for the ceiling hoist at home. Breakfast was very good, nice choice of food in a very pleasant dining room. The location of the hotel was very good and within walking distance of many main attractions. All in all an excellent break. Will certainly use this hotel again, just wist it were a little cheaper

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but nowhere near 4 star”
Reviews.Author: BillyF1975
Reviews.Content: Firstly, ignoring the price and focusing on the actual rooms/service, I should say that as a 3 star hotel, this hotel is actually very reasonable. There were small things like 2 of the 3 lifts not working, the tissues in the bathroom were almost empty (only 2 left) when I checked in, the bathroom was very small so that I needed to stand either side of the toilet to open/close the door, and most of the items on the 24hr room service were not actually available, but in general, the room was good, clean, and had the basics. The bed was also comfortable. My concern is that I booked this hotel as a mystery 4 star hotel on lastminute.com (currently asking them why they believe it is a 4 star hotel). I was very surprised when I arrived (due to the above), and there is no mention of it being a 4 star hotel anywhere in the building. I asked at reception, and they did not know who had rated it. The first person I spoke to said it was based on surveys left in the rooms. Hmmm... I asked someone else, and they said that the rating was based on trip advisor reviews, and on their parent company's opinion. So, there is nothing from VisitEngland or the AA or any other independent reviewer. Based on this, I think this hotel is being a unfair; they are not officially rated as a 4 star hotel, and it is obvious that they are not a 4 star hotel when you get there and check in, but you will probably not know this until you have booked and paid. I will follow up with lastminute.com to stay that selling this hotel as a 4 star mystery is not fair to the unsuspecting buyer. At over £400 a night for rack rate, I think this is too much, hence the poor review score. Pls note there are no fitness/swimming facilities in the hotel. You have to visit somewhere close by and pay. But, I do want to point out, as I started with, that this is a reasonable 3 star quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value - would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MrsW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends for a weekend theatre break. The hotel was one tube ride away from Kings Cross station and very easy for us to get to. It is within 3-4 minute walk from Russel Square tube. The reception staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. You have to use your key card to operate the lift, which made us feel secure in the hotel. Our rooms were fairly small but well appointed, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom came with shampoo/soap/shower gel. Tea/coffee making facilities were provided and there was also controllable air con, a hairdryer and flat screen tv. We were very satisfied with what we had. The Breakfast buffet was very good, continental and full English were available and the cooked breakfast was very nicely done and not greasy. Tea/coffee was brought to your table by the very pleasant staff. If you need anything else there is a Tesco extra and an ATM machine around the corner from the hotel. Which was in a quiet location so that we weren't disturbed by London traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for your london trip”
Reviews.Author: jill186394
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one tube stop from Kings Cross and when you exit the tube at Russell Square you just cross the road and it is straight ahead then round the corner. We found the staff all really pleasant and the food was nice in the restaurant. The breakfasts are fab and we found filled us up for the day! On our last day we found a mini shopping mall with shops such as Oasis and River Island and lots of eating places just round the corner - there are also about 3 parks around the hotel so all in all a really nice place to base your stay in London as you away from the hustle and bustle but near enough to have a quick trip on the tube. Covent Garden is only 2 tube stops away. The bathrooms are very small but functional but we hardly spent any time in the room so for a good nights sleep it ticked all the boxes and the room was quiet.I would highly recommend it for a good base when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and would certainly stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Failand
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally situated for all that we wanted to do. It was easy to get to theatres from here and it was an easy walk down to the Thames. The staff were very pleasant, the room was spotless and the breakfast was excellent. There was also a wide choice of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic...definately not 4*”
Reviews.Author: pink_lizzie
Reviews.Content: Booked through last minute.com as a 'top secret' hotel... allegedly a 4*... I've done this previously and been pleasantly suprised... but not this time! So although we had booked only the day before, and received a better deal (£93.25 for one night, room only) - I don't feel this should mean you receive a lesser service. Also advised that if we booked breakfast now it would be £9.95 each or if we booked in the morning it would be £16.95 each (not sure why...) Upon arrival, the rather rude receptionist told me I had booked a smoking room. I politely responded that as neither myself or my partner smoke, I certainly hadn't - and I had the booking confirmation to prove it! I was then told that smoking rooms were all that was available. We contemplated going to stay elsewhere, but as the room was non refundable, thought we would check out the room.. The smell of smoke was noticeable, but bearable... as the hotel room windows do not open at all - there was no way to get any air into the room and due to the hot weather was extremely hot! (this was fine once the air con was on!) Very small room and bathroom - very basic! I would compare to a Travel Lodge or Premier Inn - certainly not a 4*... I imagine it's classed a 4* due to amenities such as a 'desk' and a 'kettle' however all were very poor quality. The flat screen TV was good though.. The bathroom was tiny - unless the door was closed you couldnt move between the sink and the bath. However the redeeming quality of this hotel is definately the location - right next to Russell Square tube with direct links to Covent Garden and also within walking distance of the West End, Oxford St and Kings Cross. As it is set back from the main road, it is also very quiet from outside noise! The noise proofing between rooms isnt great, but I think you find that a lot these days - luckily our neighbours weren't too bad! Behind the hotel is the lovely Brunswick centre - with shops and restaurants, and below the hotel is an Irish bar - we didnt go in but it looked busy! Overall... we had a great time and the location was perfect - but I would definiately not stay here again! If you shopped around you would definitely get a better deal! Average all round..

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: leegoffin54
Reviews.Content: We picked to stay here as it was between Harley Street and the West End with a car park next door ( £20. for 24 hours). We arrived at 2.30pm and our appointment in Harley Street was 2.45pm. The receptionist was very pleasant and efficient. She had us checked in and a taxi ordered which arrived in 5 minutes from our arrival. Our room was on the 5th floor and a bit small. The bathroom was the same but clean although a bit dated. A big plus was lots of mirrors in sensible places. Even the hairdryer reached the mirror. The double bed was comfortable with one firm pillow and one soft. The hotel bar was still open at midnight although coffee wasn't available, we could make one in our room if we wanted to. Breakfast was ok. The dining room was again dated and our table could have done with a wipe before we sat down.There was no table cloth on the tables and we had to ask for coffee. Breakfast was self service and a selection of full English, cereals, fresh fruit, juices ham cheese coissants and toast. Breakfast was 7am to 11am. All 3 lifts worked but you have to insert your room key to operate it upwards. There is a small sign in the lift saying this but it is only in English. It would have been helpful if the receptionist told us this. All in all it was on ok hotel for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a bit mean-spirited”
Reviews.Author: jenny255115
Reviews.Content: Yes, there are couches in the lobby, but not ones you could ever relax on. Yes, we supply a free paper but you have to join our loyalty scheme first. Yes, there is a bath in the room but it is very small. Staff were all polite and helpful. Our room was small and tight and had a trouser press positioned to make movement difficult. It also had two desk type furniture pieces that further cluttered the room. This hotel serves its purpose but lacks engagement.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, friendly, super breakfasts, and great location”
Reviews.Author: farenough
Reviews.Content: Located just 1/2 a block from Russell tube station. Super quiet room; we never heard street noise, and never even heard noise from halls (we were at end of hall). Hotel was prepaid by Hotel Connect which went bankrupt two days before our trip, so we had to pay again but hotel still provided room at same rate (actually slightly less) despite rooms being at a premium because of Wimbledon. Mgmt went out of their way to sort things out. (TravelVisa reimbursed us for payment to HotelConnect). the bed was great. Our daughter slept on the sofa bed which was horrible, even for a kid. She ended up sleeping on the sofa proper, not its' bed. The breakfasts were terrific. Good selection, fresh fruit, cereals, juices, hot foods, etc. Have already recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good, overall.”
Reviews.Author: Honestopinion_10
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn lives up to the standards one would expect of this chain. Quiet rooms were available at this central London address, but don't expect too much of a view. Excellent breakfast, albeit a little impersonal in terms of atmosphere. Staff made every effort to be helpful when problems of Internet access arose. Worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: john_ecko
Reviews.Content: i took my partner here for a trip to London and the hotel was nice and clean. rooms were ample size but clean. good links to Russell square tube station and a 15 min walk to euston station too. didnt really spend much time in the hotel but its like any other holiday inn really

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: shadeofshyness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and it was easy to walk to from Holborn tube station. Nice room and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and location”
Reviews.Author: JulieandPaul100
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. The meeting rooms are very functional and it is only a few miutes walk from Euston, Kings Cross , St Pancras. Good value, convenient

Reviews.Title: “Crap!!!! Complete waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Emiliascott
Reviews.Content: Terrible value. Rooms very tiny, no fridge, bathroom cramped, cannot open window, 1970 decor. Cell block h. Would positively NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chuckienewcastle
Reviews.Content: Having read the negative reviews on this hotel I can only say that some folk are very hard to please. I've just returned from a two night stay and can honestly say that the hotel was ideal. The rooms were average size (not small), very clean and quiet - which is unusual for central London. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We had breakfast both mornings and evening meal on our second night and I couldn't fault the food. The location of the hotel is perfect - close to tube and bus links, walking distance to Covent Garden and the West End and right next to a good selection of shops and restaurants for those who prefer to stay close to the hotel. I will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, nice location great stay shame about the room service always check you bill from them.”
Reviews.Author: 1314mac
Reviews.Content: Returned from this hotel early June combined business with pleasure, by taking the wife with me for an enjoyable overdue long weekend. Hotel was clean & staff friendly, great location also, however I ordered a well done steak baguette from room service on last night, unfortunately it was still alive. Rather than kick off my better half suggested we not ruin a great weekend so I left until the morning to report. I followed that up by informing customer complaints when back home, to-date no further response from them Since we had a great time did not pursue the matter any further however having joined this companies loyalty rewards club then I decide to make another booking this weekend to another of their hotel chain & I have been overcharged from original agreedbooking reservation. Watch this company hopefully they will deal with this issue more professionally than the last.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juretennis1
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated with all amenities one would expect from a business hotel. The only critic I have is that one should not be extracharged for WLAN in a business hotel nowadays! Very convenient is the Bloomsbury center nearby and the tube station Russel Square which is located just 150m from the hotel. So a quick ride to the City center. The fitness club doesnot belong to the hotel and is also only available for extra charge, Could be better solved (no costs for hotel guests...)

Reviews.Title: “nice location,good staff, Tiny rooms! even for london.”
Reviews.Author: maggs74
Reviews.Content: stayed with my husband friday night using priorty points. room was tiny especially the bathroom,You had to squeeze past door to get inside I did wonder if we were given a smaller room as we were using points ? However we had forgotton our tickets for the show we were due to see that night and Gary the concierge and the other tall young man at the desk were extremely polite and helpful Gary rang the theatre on our behalf and arranged a new set of tickets Thank you! It would have ruined our weekend if we hadn't been able to go since it was a birthday treat We didnt have breakfast but apart from small room would consider staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff - fabulous breakfast - fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: thibodeau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to this hotel as we so enjoyed a previous stay. The hotel is still fabulous - the staff are helpful beyond words and are always cheery - even when the entire hotel lost its hot water on two different days - boiler issue. Once this was resolved, all was well. The Concierge, Keith, is a wealth of information on tours, London and shopping and is extremely personable all while juggling a thousand balls in the air! Our room was immaculately clean and the room staff couldn't do enough to make our stay a success. The breakfast room staff are fabulous and the food wonderful...especially the scrambled eggs and porridge!! Can't thank you enough and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stw1961
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a couple of nights last weekend, great location for us as close to the centre but also close to Kings Cross, right next to tube station and Brunswick Centre. Good breakfast (get the £9.50 vouchers when you arrive as opposed to £16.50 in the morning) - I'm sure you could find better value breakfasts close by but it was convenient. Room maybe a little small for the 3 of us but clean and serviceable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfectly fine though unexceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dubmumof2
Reviews.Content: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. Clean, organised and anonymous hotel. So close to town and tube though and on a great tube line too. Room could have been described as small but was a good size for London I think, beds were reasonably comfortable. Bathroom was clean and functional though not luxurious! Quiet enough area that noise was certainly not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in central London!”
Reviews.Author: whereonearthami
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, choosing it again for its location and predictability. Although expensive, with the Canadian Dollar to British Pound conversion, it is competitive with pricier hotels in central London. Everything is new, fresh and clean, with the rooms and bathrooms comparatively large for London, and air-conditioned. Although the windows do not open, they do have small vents at the top that open and close. The hotel is around the corner from Russell Hill tube station, on the Piccadilly line, and two minutes walk to the sightseeing bus. The hotel will let you use the computer to check-in with your airline and print your boarding pass at no charge. You must choose the breakfast option in advance/at check-in for the best price, although there are places around the hotel where you can have a quick bite. The one negative: On the last night of my stay, I managed only 2 hours sleep due to periodic loud talking and laughing by a small group outside the window (possibly hotel staff on break). The problem ceased after calling the front desk at 4 a.m. If you don't have, or want to spend time researching hotels/flats/b&b's, this is a great hotel, modern, clean, centrally located, and on the main tube line through central London.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: atlhonest
Reviews.Content: Really pleased we went here. Great value for money and fantastic service from the moment we checked in - front desk went out of their way to help us after arriving very early from a Sydney flight. Got a room at 10am without extra charge and everything went smoothly. Yes not the highest standard of furnishings but great value for London. Room service menu and breakfast choice were better than some 5 star we have stayed in. Located just next to small shopping and dining centre which included Waitrose, bank, Boots, Superdrug, fashion stores and lovely dining and cafes. Very handy. 1 minute to Russell Square tube.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make it a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tony48
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel whenever I am in London on business. The staff turnover is low, so there are lots of regular faces who greet me by name. The rooms on the first floor are my favourite - if full, the 6th floor has been recently refurbished with new large flat screen tv in all rooms The breakfasts are tasty, but I miss the smoked haddock that used be on the menu. The dinners are good, but the restaurant is rarely busy, so it is quiet and, for some, it lacks atmosphere. Again the staff in the dining room, both breakfast and dinner, are excellent and always give personal service. If you want atmosphere, the attached pub Callaghan's is often heaving, especially on football nights. A friendly place situated near the centre of London with the British Museum just a few minutes walk away across Russell Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: fizzywizzy
Reviews.Content: I am a wheelchair user who needs a hoist to help me in & out of bed.This hotel is one of the less than a handful of hotels in the entire country to have ceiling tracking to enable me to be away from home.Thank you so much Holiday Inn,I really hope you will install tracking & facilities in ALL your hotels.Back to the review--We found the room beautifully clean,plenty of space for my wheelchair,large bathroom,comfy bed.Fabulous.We found the staff to be most pleasant & helpful.All in all,having such a lovely hotel meant I could thoroughly enjoy my 5 days holiday.I recommend the hotel & central Bloomsbury.Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value, With Wasted Potential”
Reviews.Author: zoro1985
Reviews.Content: Before I begin, let me state that I stayed in this hotel on 2 separate occasions, one week apart. On both occassions I feel that the hotel let itself down. Firstly let me start off with the bad things: - The price is terrible for what you get. I happy to have expensive hotel, but I expect some quality. at £210 per night, you don't want a hotel which will give you a bad experience - this hotel fails. - Reception staff rude, and potentially arrogant at times. I stay in hotels pretty much 5 days a week, every week so the occassion bad experience is expected, but two stays in a row of this at the same hotel is unnacceptable. - Priority Club Members: If you a platinum member expecting an upgrade, then don't... on both my stay the said the would not be upgrading me - the a colleague of mine checks in after me with a different receptionist and gets the upgrade... where is the logic? However, if and probably when you don't get your upgrade, the receptionist does offer to send the executive basket to your standard room - a bit of consolation? Well don't get too excited, as the "excutive basket" is basically a Kit-Kat Chunky and a bottle of Water (which you only recieve for your first night.) - Rooms: I find the rooms very small and cramped - even the executive rooms (I had a look in my colleague's room), and on my first stay her, the maids didn't even bother to clean the room, meaning I had to re-use my wet towels, my bin was full of rubbish, an ofcourse the unmade bed sheets - not what you expect for £210 per night! - Noise: It is worth mentioning that a lot of noise seems to get into the rooms, which can affect your sleep if you are a light-sleeper - this may be because it is an extremely busy hotel, but they should try to make the rooms a but more sound-proof. This noise can come from the bar outside, the hallways or even the rooms next to or above you. Ok so now the good points: - Breakfast: I really liked the breakfasts here, the food was very good, and the staff at breakfast were very professional. Breakfast is an extra £11.50, which is pricey, but it is good food to be fair. - Location: Excellently located in central London, so everything you need is walking distance - Reception/ Lobby: Very well presented, bright and clean looking. Overall, I think the negatives out-weight the positives. I don't think this hotel is value for money - this comes from a business traveller where I don't even pay for it (my company picks up the bill) and I still don't like it. So if the was your own hard earned money, I would not even consider this place as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night and glad it wasn't for longer. The room was tiny and very basic (no bar fridge etc), service was slow (took 30 mins to check in and room service never showed) and the room was extremely expensive for what you get (I know this is London but this was day-light robbery). We got the room through a secret room offer on lasminute but so wish we just paid for somewhere with similar price for better quality. We also had issues with the hotel charging us for expenses not incurred. To speak to someone about this through telephone customer service was slow and laborious. The only positive for the hotel is its location but we won't be staying at the hotel again. If you can avoid it, do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: LucyFog79
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed overnight here and found the staff to be very friendly, professional and helpful. The room (twin) was lovely - it was modern and clean with a large flat screen tv, as well as the usual tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer (a fairly powerful one at that), soaps, shampoo etc. The rooms are airconditioned. The breakfast was served as a buffet with plenty on offer, full English, continental, cereal, fruits etc. It was very tasty and again, the staff were great. We didn't eat lunch or dinner here so I can't comment on the restaurant in that respect. They offer a left luggage service so you can drop off your bags if you arrive before check in time, and you are welcome to leave your luggage after you check out too - very handy if you are exploring London! All in all, a very enjoyable experience - well done Holiday Inn Bloomsbury! The location is ace - very close to Russel Square tube station and a short walk away from Euston and Euston Square tube, so very handy for getting around London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: NYPNYC
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! Service was top notch - reception, housekeeping, the restaurant and bar - everyone was helpful, gracious, and knowledgeable. The bed and bedding were extremely comfortable, the black-out drapes were very effective, and the room was very quiet - a great night's sleep. Large HD television in the room, plenty of closet space. The least expensive rooms are small but fine for a couple. The more expensive rooms are very roomy. In both size rooms, the bathroom is quite large and well-appointed. The rates were typical for nice hotels in this area of London. The Russell Square tube station is right there and the Picadilly Line goes all the way to Heathrow for 5 pounds. The neighborhood is lovely with many nice restaurants, convenience and drug stores. Russell Square Park is very pretty and just around the corner. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is free to join the Holiday Inn Priority Club Rewards program and earn points for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Findus2009
Reviews.Content: My friend and me was looking forward to stay in this hotel for 3 nights. The room was prepaid a long time ago and we though it would be no problems, but we were wrong! After a long journey from home and a nearly 2 hours cew at Stanstead airport to get by the security check we were very tired and looking forward to a good nights sleep. Arriving to the hotel the problems start, there weren't any room for us.We had to wait for a cab to take us to another hotel, and to be picked up there the next day.( This was in the middle of the night) We soon learned that we weren't the only ones that this has happened to- at least 3 other that we spoke to had experienced the same. It didn't help a lot that they gave us a bottle of wine and some water and chocolat, placed in our room, with no cards or any excuses at all!!! Jan from Norway

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Slyph
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and was very disappointed by the quality of the hotel. Room - Small, grotty and all furniture in the room had significant scrapes and gouges. Walls are thin, meaning we could hear everything that went on in the bathroom next door. Bed - Comfortable and clean, however, do not expect to sleep beyond 7am when the symphony of door slamming starts as people leave their rooms. Bathroom - Small and grotty. If you book via the Holiday Inn website then please be aware that whilst it clearly states that breakfast is included - it is not. My husband met with the hotel manager to discuss this and we were given vouchers for a free breakfast on the second morning of our stay. Although this addressed our concern, the breakfast itself was appalling. The ingredients of the cooked breakfast were very poor quality, the fruit was unripe and we were unable to drink the tea as it had obviously been stewing in pots for a long time. Although in a good location the amount of money charged for this poor quality hotel room is obscene. Needless to say we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A top place to stay”
Reviews.Author: martinshrimper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fast becoming my favourite place to stay in London. It starts at the reception with friendly,courteous,efficient, and very helpful staff. As a Platinum PC member I am always reconised here as such, something I do not always get at other HI hotels. I like the bar/lounge area which is spacious and comfortable and once again the staff here are very friendly and efficient. The food in the lounge is excellent ,compliments to the chefs. In the room the new HD large TV's are a real bonus, and as ever the rooms are clean and well prepared. This hotel is a credit to its staff and management and they should all be congratulated, WELL DONE..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect. If you do not need a bigger room ...”
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo_de_Berceo
Reviews.Content: What can we say ? Service is brilliant, from check-in, over breakfast, to check-out. This must be the best hotel staff we have ever come across... (except for the 'omelette' chef who clearly does not like his job). Rooms are very clean and quiet. But the standard rooms are also ... quite small. If you are travelling on your own, that wouldn't be a problem, but for a couple I can imagine some more space around the bed and in the bathroom might be nice. It is indeed impossible for two persons to be in the bathroom at the same time. They should have made one room out of every two rooms, but probably that would have lead to unaffordable room rates. Talking of which: given the location of this hotel (walking distance between St Pancras and Covent Garden) room rates are reasonable indeed. Saved to My Favorites.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but London has its price”
Reviews.Author: tgoeldenitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed during an exhibition in the city. The hotel is nice, clean, has what it needs, and is more than an average Holiday Inn. The price is however also in the range of a very good five star - which seems to be the case all over London where hotels seem to have a different level of price than elsewhere. For the price the room size is not that great, but again I this seem to be a general point in London where you pay a lot for less space. The Duty Manager did his best to assist us in handling things with parking a big vehicle and other matters, an Italian gentleman who has a good idea of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice in London! Would surely stay again”
Reviews.Author: sybilthegreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HI Bloomsbury in February for 4 nights. We had a great experience. We were in 604 I believe. Truthfully we had a little reservation issue but the staff bent over backwards to help us so no points off for that at all! Hotel location is absolutely perfect. Close to Covent Garden and around the corner from the Piccadilly Line. There is a Tesco and Pret a Manger there and a funky outdoor mall with even more options just steps away. Check- in was effortless and front desk staff were very nice and helpful. The hotel is very modern and nicely appointed. Room was incredibly spacious and clean. Surprisingly so by European standards! Bed was super comfy. We didn't hear an iota of street noise. What really impressed us was even though they were doing renovations on the 6th floor, they were very quiet and really kept the hallways clean and tidy. There was always a staff member up there supervising the work and they always greeted us and offered help. The only reason this hotel is 4 stars for me is because the WiFi is CRAZY overpriced and usually HI's have a pretty good breakfast where this one did not have breakfast included. Would absolutely stay again! Here's a tip too- they often have BOGO or 2 for 1 specials so check that out!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CelticPathfinder
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for two nights in an Exec Floor level 6 room. Nice clean room, bed very comfortable and aircon worked fine. Secondary glazing on window meant almost no road noise from outside which is a big plus for a city centre hotel in London. Complimentary water & chunky kitkat bar supplied each day and tea/coffee available in room. Bathroom was very clean and well laid out with good water pressure from the in-bath shower.. Didn't need the breakfast in the hotel, or in fact take any other meals there, and used the Tesco express & corner shops for snacks. Internet access in the room was £15 for 24 hours which is far too expensive so used my O2 mobile broadband at £2 instead with excellent signal strength. ( Why do some hotels persist in charging so much for wifi internet access ??? ) Enjoyed the 46 inch TV in the room ! Location is great - just 2 mins from Russell Square tube and bus stops to Kings X and Aldwych / Strand / T. Square - and taxis easily available aroud the hotel. Overall a pleasant stay .

Reviews.Title: “worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: ikke48
Reviews.Content: very good location, close to center, british museum, very friendly staff, nice English breakfast (but quite expensive, like the whole of London)

Reviews.Title: “Not too great”
Reviews.Author: Hunny76
Reviews.Content: Location was definitely the biggest reason why we stayed at this hotel. It is just across the street from the Russell Square tube station which is on the Piccadily line (direct line from Heathrow) and it saved us a ton of money on taxi fares. It is also walking distance to St. Pancras International train station (we had an early train to Paris to catch) and to the British museum. Overall, it was ok but definitely not a 4-star hotel. The tub in our bathroom had mold and mildew growing and some of the hotel staff were not very friendly or helpful. We arrived at around 10 am, and despite requesting for early check in, we were told that our room was not ready yet and we will have to wait until 1PM. After an hour of waiting in the lobby, I approached another lady at the front desk and she told us our room was ready. I wish they had told us that it was ready instead of having us sit and wait in the lobby. =/ WiFi is very expensive at 15 pounds an hour and breakfast is 16 pounds per person. It is possible to get breakfast vouchers the day before at a discounted rate as well. This hotel was pricey and over-rated... but location-wise, I will recommend it. If you can afford a little bit more, stay some where else nicer. This is one of the hotels that will be part of the Olympic Athletes village and I definitely think they need a lot more work before the 2012 Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Eve159
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. Our room was ready early, clean but a bit small. I guess it’s not really a problem if you plan on visit London and only need a place to sleep. The location is very convenient with Rusell Square station being right at the corner and St Pancras less than 15 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: CDNTourist2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is safe and clean. Room was average in size and bathroom had a hand held shower head. Amenities included an in-room safe, phone, LCD TV (clock and alarm were in the TV), two sets of towels (one set was in the closet next to the safe), and a hair dryer. Staff were friendly and efficient. . The self service breakfast had plenty of choices for everyone. Hotel is well located, less than a couple minutes walk to the tube station, two grocery stores, a pharmacy, a Post Office, several banks and many restaurants. Russell Square tube station, on the Piccadilly Line, means that the ride from Heathrow is 52 minutes. Theatre district is 20-30 minute walk. The park, Russell Square, is also a two minute walk from the hotel. My only caution would be to not accept food from the staff in the lobby with out clarifying if it is free. I was offered a piece of satay and then was charged £2.75 for a small skewer of meat.

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean, peaceful hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeL3
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our choice of hotel in central London. Very convenient for the stations and the centre - easy walking distance to Kings Cross and the British Museum. The staff were very helpful and polite and the breakfast was good - better than most. There are pleasant lounges to sit in and virtually no traffic noise, despite being so near to Russell Square on the day of the big march. We will certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel right in the center of london”
Reviews.Author: pleasure721
Reviews.Content: very nice and good located hotel, just a few steps away from oxford street and the west end, very clean and very wellcoming

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in super location”
Reviews.Author: hexaminer
Reviews.Content: i have stayed on two occasions for a few days . The hotel is well placed for Kings Cross and the West End/Covent Garden. Good breakfast and rooms quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Jakey2012
Reviews.Content: Drove to this hotel and dropped the car off at a Hertz office around the corner. Very convenient. Worth thinking about if you have to drive. Is in the congestion zone but because we only did it once wasnt a big deal. Stayed one night prior to an early morning Eurostar departure. 10 minute walk to station but you could easily take a cab in less than 5. Tube stop (Russell Square) around the corner makes access to sights of London easy. Plenty of places nearby to grab a bite or snack. Check in and out was quick and efficient. Room was fine. Nice pillows. Bathroom decent without being great. Disappointed at no free wifi. Overall more than happy for the one night... if it was 3, then maybe I would look elsewhere... somewhere more 'British'.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller063
Reviews.Content: Stay here regularly when in London as it is quiet by London standards and you can get a good nights sleep away from the main road. Most rooms are reasoanbly sized although some on the upper floors can be quite small. Decent food and well organised reception allows for quick check in and out. One thing I do dislike about Holiday Inn in London generally is that they quote the prices net of local taxes which so happens to be the VAT at 20% which makes a significant difference if you aren't staying on business. They don't seem to pull this trick outside London. Very sneaky in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “good business type hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, just in front of Russel Sq station with many restaurant/pubs in area. Walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: eyelanddoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night and wished we stayed for our next 2 nights instead of at another hotel we moved to thinking that would be better. Efficient check in and welcoming staff. Booked with points including free breakfast. Assigned to room 102, executive club (not sure what that means) - nice and quiet end of the hotel. Pleasantly surprised with the size, cleanliness, comfort of bed, bathroom, huge tv. Large selection at breakfast with efficient and pleasant staff. Convenient location 2 minutes from Russell Square. Easy walk to the busy Covent Garden, Leceister Square, etc. Overall, lovely experience at a chain hotel, very organized, great value! Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with very good Location”
Reviews.Author: sib7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Room was ready for 11;30 am which was a real bonus. Rooms very clean. All the Staff very friendly and polite. Russel Square tube is a real bonus as this the main line into central London which takes about 2 minutes. Also main line route to Heathrow airport Lefts the bags at reception when booked out and picked back up 5 hours later with no problem and very secure. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on business trip that went on late. Location is great - right by Brunswick centre with shops, restaurants, starbucks etc and 2 min walk from Russell Square tube station. Service was friendly and didn't feel processed which can be the case with big chains in London. Minor complaint was random child who was knocking on doors and screaming at 1am - but I guess it's not the hotels fault that some parents aren't parents!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesdawsonprudhoe
Reviews.Content: It's pot luck with hotels in London , but this one is a decent, clean, quite easy to get to establishment. It is a good location for the west end, 20 - 25 minutes walk. Rooms typically quite small but well equipped and very clean . Breakfast was good and reception staff were polite and helpful, all in all a nice short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: sirlenscap
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inns used to be a cut-above most in the middle leisure or business sector. Based on the Bloomsbury, London, Holiday Inn this week they have dumbed down and are now sitting alongside the budget chains sadly. Yes it is centrally located and only 30 minutes from Covent Garden on foot, and yes it is clean. But the standard rooms are very, very small and the service is only just about ok. And they are after every extra pound they can grab: £26 a day for tv movies..... ouch. Goodness knows what the drinks in the mini-bar would cost - we will never find out as the fridge was empty for our four nights! By way of entertainment, the builders started work at 8am in the rooms across the passage way every morning. Hmmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable rooms. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Cmugrad
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 6 nights 10-16 March. The location is excellent. Around the corner from the Russell Square tube station (Picadilly line), next to shopping area with a full service Waitrose supermarket. The hotel itself is nondescript- boxy and modern but the room was very clean and comfortable. Bathroom great with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Walking distance to British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great business-style hotel, great central London location”
Reviews.Author: DebS253
Reviews.Content: Executive rooms noticeably larger than usual double room, clean and comfortable; helpful staff; just a couple of minutes' walk to Russell Square tube station, less than 10 minutes walk to British Museum. Good quality food at the on-site restaurant. Big plus: quiet at night. Plenty of hot water for the bath. Very good value. Looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marmalade65
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights , had a smoking room ,it was small but nice,find it hard to get smoking rooms at many hotels now. when i booked i had the choice to choose a smoking room and there was no problem. staff are very helpfull no problem leaving case on day we arrived and checked out would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jamesfurze
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Staff excellent in all respects. Very good breakfast with constant offers of more coffee and tea. Evening meal overpriced compared with nearby restaurants. Room on the small size and basic but adequate. Bathroom small but "perfectly formed" and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Tube treat priority club guests well”
Reviews.Author: calenita
Reviews.Content: NICE hotel. Liked the room. Bathroom small, but family room big enough for four. They treated us well as Priority Club guests with chocolate, newspapers, bottled water and bathrobes, plus extra toiletries. NICE staff,. Kids eat free which is nice. Only downside is paying for Internet access with only option one day or one week. Should have a one hour rate or FREE Internet. Close to tube and shopping plaza with lots of restaurants. Right on Picadilly line which is great from Heathrow. Also walking distance to British Museum and from there we just walked to Westminster (30 minutes). Big cheap grocery store nearby. No fridge in room but space for fruit, crackers etc from grocery store. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, everything else average.”
Reviews.Author: ClovaTheWestie
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent. It is right next to a Tube stop, Russell Square and only a 10 minute walk from Euston. The area is good and close to many sights such as the British Museum and is within walking distance of Covent Garden etc. Rooms are a little small but perfectly adequate, appears to have been refurbished fairly recently. Internal rooms have no view at all. Staff pleasent and helpful and attached bar OK, nothing great. Restaurant, like many hotels in London very expensive for average food. Breakfast had a good selection and was plentiful. The biggest problem is this is a hotel that could be in any large city around the world. Nothing special, nothing bad but not really anything outstanding either. If i had to have a gripe about something i would say that it appeared as though every time the person in the room next to me ran a tap or flushed a toilet the water seemed to gurgle away in the pipes of my room. Slightly annoying but no big deal. Hotel is fine if you can get a deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel for a 'no frills' break”
Reviews.Author: wednesday7pm
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8pm and parked in the car park under the hotel which is run by NCP, there was plenty of space and we were welcomed by a member of staff. Check in was quick, friendly and efficient and we were given the key cards for our room which are also needed to activate the lifts, there are no stairs from the reception area. We had pad £330 for 2 nights and a further £60 was taken as a deposit against room service etc. The room was fresh and clean, a bit like a good quality premier inn. My husband was impressed that we were able to have a smoking room but as with many hotels we were unable to open windows so it became stuffy and much too hot for us at night despite the air conditioning. I had previously read about this problem on here and we did open the window vents but they weren't much help. We were amazed that in London we could hear so little noise from outside but as also mentioned previously on here the walls are very thin. Luckily our neighbours were very quiet but we heard the man next door every time he cleared his throat! I ordered room service on the second night and was told it would arrive in 30 minutes, it arrived in 15 and I received a call to check everything was ok. The maid service was also excellent. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the Brunswick Centre right next to the hotel including Giraffe, Gourmet Burger, Costa, French Connection, New Look, Superdrug etc and a lovely waitrose. We checked out at 6am, the shutters were shut but you can use your parking ticket to open them. You have to pay by card, it was £36 for 2 nights, coming from Cambridge we didn't think this was unreasonable. Unfortunately the machine wasn't working but luckily a member of staff arrived and it was quickly sorted.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot fault service cleanliness etc however the room (110), said to be an executive room, was a real let down.”
Reviews.Author: Glugalot
Reviews.Content: Too many hotels ignore soundproofing to counteract the natural and understandable noises created by guests in adjoining rooms. Our sleep was blighted by late arriving neighbours who allowed doors to slam and then talked (etc) until after 5am. It would be unfair to expect guests to be silent and it should be the hotel that ensures that sound is not transmitted to adjoining rooms. Doors should be restricted to stop any chance of them banging shut. No hotel should be forgiven for failing to insulate the sound created by toilet cisterns, lift machinery and airconditioning etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nic110470
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a couple of nights sightseeing for my family and I. got there about 12 and room wasnt ready but not a problem,they stored our luggage while we went out. room was clean and had tea and coffee making facilities,plenty of all the stuff you need. bathroom was small but it doesnt matter,it was clean and plenty of towels. location is ideal for either walking to sights or using tube around the corner. breakfast was good altough hard to get tea and coffee from waiting staff,self service would be better. had an evening meal and it was lovely,daughter ate free so even better. I must praise the consierage Gary who was the best member off staff in the hotel,he gave us loads of advice on using tubes and how to get to places,nothing was too much trouble for him. He is a credit to the hotel. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, just a few little annoyances..”
Reviews.Author: sare1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a Theatre break and included full breakfast which was really good. Room - small and compact. Tea/coffee facilities but never enough sugar and milk left. Also a hairdryer in a drawer but no mirror nearby. Wash basin took a while to drain away too. Check in the wardrobe for extra towels which I missed! It would be nice to have a window which opened too as room could get stuffy even with A/C.

Reviews.Title: “good location and service”
Reviews.Author: yaakovamir
Reviews.Content: Me n my wife just came back from a 5 days vacation to London. The hotel met our expectations. The hotel is located only 2 minutes walk from the tube station russell square which is in the middle of London and u can get from there anywhere. There r 2 supermarkets 2 minutes walk if u need to buy something and also a few restaurants 2 minutes walk. We ate sushi at the close shopping center. The room was a bit small but it didn’t bother us. It was clean and comfortable also the mattress was too fluffy. The stream at the bath was very good. we couldnt open a window. shortly it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient”
Reviews.Author: DitaV2
Reviews.Content: Rooms: clean, good size for London, flat panel TV, good water pressure Breakfast: good buffet, reasonable price for hotel breakfast buffet, restaurant was clean and not too noisy Service: room service was good, front desk staff was excellent, no fancy frills just fast service

Reviews.Title: “far from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: cakes57
Reviews.Content: a great location as it's far from the madding crowds of the normal tourist trail. couldn't be closer to the tube and with reasonable neighbourhood cafes and restaurants you won't have to stray far. rooms a bit on the small side but very clean and staff very welcoming and helpful. don't think we'd stay for more than a couple of days due to smallish rooms but definitely use again for a flying visit

Reviews.Title: “A bit far out but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: cleanconscioustravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to Russell Square station (something we could have done with knowing before we got there..we got out of the station and decided to start walking and found it by accident). Our concierge was EXCELLENT. Helped us out with all our questions and he has an excellent friendly personality. The actualy staff on the reception desk were not so good. No personality and not very helpfull. The breakfast is expensive but you can load up on cereals, toast, fruit, croissants, eggs and meats. Cheaper option is to eat breakfast at the bar and just get what you want. The room was clean, a bit small but really dont need much room when you are sightseeing all day and just coming back to sleep basically. The bathroom was also very clean. Might be a bit worn but nothing to worry about. The hop on/hop off buses and also regular buses stop close to the hotel. From the hotel we walked to: Traf sq, Leister Sq. Buckingham Palace, Downing St...all the major places in one day. Dont recommend doing the walk if you dont enjoy walking distances. There is one public computer but you have to pay and buy in blocks of time. Really bad water pressure in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean but hotel reception not very welcoming or seeming very willing to help”
Reviews.Author: hot17
Reviews.Content: great location, approx 5 min walk away from euston station. clean and tidy. restaurant nice and staff very helpful and welcoming, however couldnt really say the same for reception staff, not very welcoming or quick when arrived, got the impression they were not that bothered. Asked at reception to book a taxi for us in the evening, taxi didnt turn up and nobody even informed or acknowledged us as to if or where the taxi was... . very noisy at night with guests coming through corridors late, no signs anywere to inform guests to keep noise to a quiet level at night as seen in some other hotels we have stayed at. however overall not a bad hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Molpe Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. Extremely nice staff. Very good breakfast. Good room. A little noicy air condition. Nice price. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay perfect!”
Reviews.Author: qcvill
Reviews.Content: I came with my Mum for a 3 night theatre break. This Hotel is in a fantastic location right next to Russel Square tube station so it's a great base for exploring London. Not far from Kings Cross either so a cheap taxi ride to the station. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable and have everything you want. The breakfast is to die for, and all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpfull. We had one evening meal in the Hotel and although expensive (what you would expect to pay in a Hotel) it was delicious. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean tidy accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ozgirloverseas
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a busy hotel for conferences yet we couldn't even tell. Close to both Russell Square Tube station and short walk from St Pancras where the Eurostar came in. Plenty of little pubs and a Tesco supermarket nearby. Rooms fresh, clean, passageways also same. Breakfast good. Try the advance purchase rate its good.

Reviews.Title: “Little change in 25 years”
Reviews.Author: IanAberdeen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet location, but Russell Square underground station is only 2 minutes walk. It has been given a facelift since I last stayed here – 25 years ago – when it was branded as a Crest Hotel. Small but comfortable rooms, with tiny bathrooms – rather expensive if you pay the rack rate, but most people seemed to be tourists who were no doubt paying less. Adequate choice at breakfast. Breakfast room can be busy at weekends. Reasonably priced cocktail bar.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here - it's excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Andrewiltn
Reviews.Content: Rang up before to check about leaving bag as we would be arriving around 0930. When we arrived at 0930 surprised and delighted to find that the reception girl checked us straight in, so after an early start and a flight we were able to go to our room and freshen up. Rooms are small but so are any reasonably priced rooms in central London. Our room was very clean. It did not have a flat screen TV but the bath and shower were fabulous as we have come to expect from Holiday Inn. Both firm and soft pillows on the bed as well. Breakfast was very good with a chef making fried and poached eggs to order. Good selection of fruit, cereals and bread. Coffee and tea were out of a flask and not very good. All staff that we met were of very high standard, attentive and friendly. Particular praise to concierge and his staff who arranged for me to do online check in for return flight on their computer and they printed out the boarding "cards". Location is very good. Direct tube line from Heathrow to Russell Square and then a 50 meter walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Repeated stay at Holiday Inn Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: tonyhar
Reviews.Content: I stay here three or four times a year and have always found it excellent. Friendly staff and always helpful. Will return next week.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mandy8255
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel staff extremely friendly and attentive. Couldn't do enough to help. Stayed for buffet breakfast which was delicious and plenty to choose from. The room was comfortable had a good nights sleep. Not a great lot of milk and sugar for drinks but reception were only to happy to provide more on request. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-poorly organized hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hushed
Reviews.Content: Not exactly what I had expected from a Holiday Inn.Tiny room with double bed when I had asked for two single beds, tiny bathroom,the hair dryer was hidden in a drawer in the room far from a mirror.As I 'm from Greece I didn't know I couldn't use my electrical and electronic devices without a proper adoptor which I MYSELF had to buy for five pounds because the hotel doesn't provide a proper one! In addition ,every morning we were asked to sign a special form in order to have breakfast ,as they couldn't understand that when we booked the hotel we had made arrangements for breakfast to be included.I have to say we weren't thrilled with the variety of food but we really enjoyed the fresh croissants.Half the days we stayed there, they would bring one set of towels for 2 people and the bathroom offered just the basic two bottles-shampoo and shower gel.No fridge to be seen either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location for shopping or business”
Reviews.Author: Carl_Ruck
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on many occasions when on business and have never been disappointed. Staff are always helpful and courteous with good choice of rooms on arrival (being a Platinum Priority Club member probably helps!). Rooms aren't huge but I usually request a twin rather than double which gives more space. This is a 4* in central London so you get what you pay for. Big plus is Callaghans Irish pub which is attached the hotel. This is ideal for watching live sport whilst enjoying a good choice of bar meals in an informal atmosphere if you don't want to eat in the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: shonC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the busy time of last week of the year. The best thing is the LOCATION - Very quiet and safe neighbourhood, just near the tube station of Russell squere in which the piccadili line goes through. This line passes the main tourists attractions without line changes and most important - goes to Heathrow directly. This was great benefit and very comfortable. I recommend using the Oyster cards. Also there is nice small shopping centtre just nearby that let you start or end your day with nice coffee bar or restaurant out of the crowdy areas. The hotel itself is OK - typical holiday inn, not luxury but suficient. very nice breakfast. make sure to attend before 9am to avoid waiting line. recdommended very much for holiday travellers that seeks quiet centre location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money, clean and respectable”
Reviews.Author: pildyboys
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, modern rooms immaculate, helpful staff. Good handy location

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: arthurh
Reviews.Content: Very little else to say, after a stressful day its disappointing to find the rooms were more tired than me!
