The one I was in, and I gather all my colleagues were in similar, was just unbelievably small, I dont want to swing a cat round but if I had there would have been no chance. Thought we would stay here for reasons of its location, I would rather travel across London than repeat this experience although I believe there are plenty of other much better hotels in this area. Its just a great shame that a brand name such as Holiday Inn cannot be relied upon to be consistent, it puts into question the whole brand and therefore future business.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: captain_gwk
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and stayed there from 8th to 12th December. PROS: The breakfast was really good with a good variety of choices. When we asked for extra heating, service was quick. Convenient place if you want to spent time in central London (Oxford street and main shopping areas). CONS: I have booked a double room with the travel agent (expedia). I checked in late in the evening to be told that there was no specification in the form the agent sent to the hotel so I had to spend the first night in single beds & in a smoking room. The next day I was transferred to a double non-smoking room but it was smaller than the first one. It goes without saying that when I book a double bed & prepay it, I am expecting a double bed no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, problems with Bill with 20% VAT charged”
Reviews.Author: Northamptonman
Reviews.Content: Stay was good and staff all helpfull. At check out there was a descrepency with Bill and VAT charge incorrect. They were unable to change as computer error! Promised to send bill on email but this has not happened and payment has been requested from Bank without signing consent!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: kerryelliott
Reviews.Content: we arrived and parked on the front of the hotel with no problems (£20 per nite) but we were able to stay in the car park til 6pm which enabled more sight seeing on departure day. The reception staff were nice and friendly. the room was a family room which had a double bed with sofa bed, the sofa bed was very uncomfortable my son (whos 12) slept on cushions on the floor on the second night, probably be ok for smaller children, we did ask for extra pillows and a blanket, did get the blanket but no pillows!!! Apparently this is the hotel that prides themselves on the WE CAN DO ANYTHING JUST ASK!!! (except pillows it seems) Breakfast was full english/continental etc, waiting staff seemed as though they did'nt understand much english, took a few goes to explain we are not finished yet before the plate was taken! we did'nt enjoy the breakfast that much, JUST OK. there is a little shop in the foyer which is handy because it sells lots but very pricey. 16 paracetamol 3.50!!! wow. The bar is nice with big leather sofas nice and relaxing. didn't use the pool so can't comment looked small! The tube is about 15min walk away, and we did find a fab indian restaurant up the road called chutney raj grays inn road. If i was visiting london again i would book elsewhere, not quite up to scratch for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Drmaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Saturday night. Reception were kind enough to let me check-in early and check-out late. The room was very clean and comfortable, breakfast was fantastic. The hotel is in quite a good location; near to Euston and the the tube. I'd recommend a stay here and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, bit noisy but that's London for you!”
Reviews.Author: foolsgold75
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious, location was great, 1 min walk to Russel Square tube and Tesco Express. Staff were helpful. Breakfast was more then adequate. Only problem was room was slightly noisy at night but this is central London!! Will stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful....they overcharge you”
Reviews.Author: Outtheoffice
Reviews.Content: Not a good experience. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury with our family as a treat for a 50th birthday. We booked three rooms via the on line booking system at a cost of £550.00 . On arrival at the hotel we found out that they had already debited our credit card for £830.00. After 20 minutes of hassle at reception we were told that this would be resolved and when we came back in the evening and there would be a note on reception confirming the refund. There was not done. So another arguement followed, our second with the hotel before we even got the room. So at 10.30 at night we demanded to see the manger explaining that it was unacceptable to provide an on line booking cost and then take an additional £280 out of someones account. Eventually we got the refund processed but only after considerable angst. Then the room key did not work when we got to the room oh and the shower was worse than useless. A great shame, if you use this hotel please check that they charge you correctly and dont let them raid your credit card account. Had the hotel tried to apologise it would have been nice but they did not so we will not be returning. The whole experience rather marred a special weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “top location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Casey26
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite hotels as the location is excellent. Less than a minutes walk from the tube station, very nice if its raining and right by a mini tesco. If you are staying out late and miss the last tube or just fancy walking then you can do this from a lot of the places around the West End and similar. Staff are always friendly and a great guy named Henry helped us out when my friend locked her key in her suitcase, saving the day. Hotel and rooms are always clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are small but clean. Although we did one time have a room which smelt a bit funky by the doorway but i'm sure that if i could have been bothered to speak to the staff about it i could have been moved with no problem. The last time we were upgraded and ended up in a huge room, very nice. Breakfast is nice with a good selection of food. Hotel is not one of the top ones but very nice for the price we get it for and is always our top choice due to location and we always enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Miminoui
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Holiday Inn Bloomsbury hotel a few years ago and we thought it was a good hotel for the price and location. So we decided to book the same hotel for our stay this year. However this time we were a bit disapointed. Our room was very small and smelled of old cigarette smoke and we could hear our neighbourg snoring during the night. The room was ok but needed a bit of maintenance, some bathroom equipments that were supposed to be hanged on the wall were just Laying on the sink surface. The minibar was missing, like if it was stollen as there was just a hole in the furniture made for it. Also we had to queue everywhere: queue to access the restaurant for breakfast (we tried different time in the morning but we still had to queue a good 10 minutes each time) queue to get full English breakfast and queue to checkout. So overall, despite the good location we will not be coming back to the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night for a theatre break last weekend, Travelled with husband and 2 teenage daughters and booked 2 double rooms. Chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Kings Cross station (15 mins walk) and easy walking distance to theatre land (25 mins walk). Tube station, bus routes and cycle station very close by plus Tesco Express and coffee bars/restaurants round the corner. Didn't go in the shopping centre but it is literally across the road. Nice friendly check-in - rooms were on the 5th floor and both were doubles but one room was quite a bit more roomy than the other even though they were the same price. Usual facilities, clean and in a good state of repair. No problem with noise even though the taxi rank was right outside. There was a notice in the reception saying that the restaurant was likey to be very busy at breakfast time due to the hotel being full. We went down at 8.30 and it was quite busy but we didn't have to wait for a table and the service was excellent as was the choice and quality of food on offer. Our daughters went down at 10.00 and they didn't encounter any problems either. When we have done a theatre break in the past we have struggled to find a good Chinese restaurant so we asked the concierge (sorry I can't remember his name) for a recommendation. He recommended 'Mr Kong' on Lisle Street (2 mins from Leicester Square) and he wasn't wrong. The food, service and price was excellent and we will definitely go there again. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. (Trip booked through Superbreak).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: HEC140
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location off Picadily Tube and Russel Square. Near British Museum and Library. Full breakfasts, quiet neighborhood, concierge service attentive. We have stayed there multiple times over the past decade and never been disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: grainnepat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend Thurs to Friday at this hotel. I travelled with my husband and two kids age 10 and 9. Or friends accompanied us. They had one child age 11. We had requested two neighbouring rooms. We booked in on arrival at 2. The rooms had one double bed and one convertible bed of good size for 2 children. The room though hot when we arrived was easy to cool with the air conditioning. The bathroom though small was adequete. The staff were at all times friendly. They dealt with all requests in a professional manner. The concierge was excellent at providing discount theatre tickets, recommending restaurants and giving directions. The location was 10 minutes walk from Oxford Street, piccadilly, Covent Gardens. it is opposite a lovely shopping centre with a choice of restaurants. It is on a direct line to the History and Science museums. It is 2 minutes walk form the tube. We booked well in advance and got an excellent band b plus dinner rate even though we only ate dinner in the hotel once. There was plenty of choice for breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel for a sight seeing trip and fro families.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms good location though look elsewhere for value for money”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNetty
Reviews.Content: stayed one night with work. not great first impressions - thye tried to charge for a room paid for by my company then tried to fob me off with a twin room when a double room had been booked. room was very small, even for London. TV is off to one side since there is no space at end of the bed. bathroom does not have full bath and you have to shut the door to get to the loo. very average toiletries. absoultely rubbish TV channel selection but then the TV did look like something from the stone age. boring room - magnolia ++. could also hear road noise from room on second floor. breakfast though was good except for the sachet of instant coffee I got when I asked for a decaf. Otherwise good choice and service prompt. the hotel is opposite a shopping arcade with amongst others hobbs, waitrose and a selection of restaurants. This is not a cheap hotel so if you are not restricted by location I would suggest looking elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Just-Decent Quality”
Reviews.Author: Aobisi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. The reason I chose this hotel is mainly because of the great location. It is 5min walk from Russell Square and 10min tube ride from St. Pancras. A school, cafes and supermarket are nearby. Reception area is clean & spacious and reception staffs are a little "welcoming" without the warm.. what i meant is they are just doing their job without passion, in another word, they are like robots.. The room is rather small for me as i had 2 large luggage bags. The room is clean but old. Anyway, didn't spend most of the time in room.

Reviews.Title: “good location, value OK”
Reviews.Author: drhenry
Reviews.Content: this hotel is only 10 minutes from St Pancras by tube, the breakfast was fine and staff efficient (friendly concierge). We found hugely different rates for this hotel, so it pays to shop around for a good rate as the rooms seem pretty standard (London - smallish size).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SirSiddington
Reviews.Content: As a new international traveler I did not know what to expect? First off if you are used to and or expecting a room as large as hotels in America then expect to pay thru the nose. The room was small based on American standards. The hotel lobby and common areas were clean safe and completely acceptable. What really sets this hotel apart from others as I see it is, Location Location Location. The hotel is located in a nice and central location of London. There is a shopping mall across the street and one block away is what I would call a Convenience Store/Grocery. Also the Tube Station ( underground subway ) is one block from front desk. Also within ten blocks of the hotel in every direction are Restaurants, Shops and Local establishments that make for a very local experience. If I had my trip to do all over I would stay a few extra days and spend more time near the hotel just walking and enjoying the area!! The Pub at the hotel However is acceptable but completely overpriced, and with just average food and beer. I would recommend exploring within a few blocks for much better fare. One place near this hotel that I would recommend is The North Sea Fish Restaurant. While a little bit more expensive well worth the money as it is not just your average Pub Fish and Chips. I also recommend "The Lamb" an authentic london Pub. The Ciaobella Italian Restaurant next to the "Lamb" rocks if you forget to get your pub grub order in before 9:PM like we did??? While the price of the hotel might have been a little high 150 british pounds per night. I wanted to book online with a "Chain" of hotels that I was familiar with?? ie... Holiday Inn.. Like I said I never traveled outside the states?? But even if you do not stay at this Holiday Inn I certainly would recommend that area completely. All in All a great time in London!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location , clean Hotel & great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PingYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perefect location for getting around to see London. There are 2 tube stations in short distance Russel Square is the closest and Euston a short walk away. Beware however Russel Square Tube has around 170 steps to climb if you dont take the lift. We braved it with 2 suitcases but would not do it again with luggage in tow, the steps are steeper and further than you think ! Hotel was clean , service was good , breakfast was excellent with porridge and poached eggs done to order. We went in the middle of half term and the hotel did not seem overcrowded, although London was ! Opposite the hotel is a place called the Brunswick centre. There is a Waitrose, a Boots chemist and quite a few restaurants including :- Yo sushi, Gormet Burger, A mexican type restaurant called Giraffe and another which I think was Thai . We will definately be returning soon to the same Hotel. Great time had by all.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: yangste
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the Russell Square area, the location of this hotel could not be better. Check in was fast and efficient and they let me check in 3 hours early. The room and bathroom were small but clean and the bed comfortable. Tv was a bit old fashioned. No fridge. There was internet but I did not use it. I did not have breakfast. The only thing I did not like was the fact that the light from the hallway shone in around the gaps in the door. Also if someone had a conversation outside, you could hear every word. There was no noise from the street though. The only other criticism I would have was about the towels - small and rather thin. All in all though a very pleasant hotel in a very safe but buzzy area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Joodie1
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Heathrow where we got on the Piccadilly Line to Russell Square tube station which took about 1 hour. The hotel is about a 5 min walk from the tube. .THe staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms spotless and the breakfast excellent. We were able to get around London very easily and could walk to Covent Garden in 15 mins. There are good shops, restaurants and attractions closeby. I will definitely go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally ordinary”
Reviews.Author: EdwinTheElf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Holiday Inn London Bloomsbury (not to be confused with the Holiday Inn Kings Cross Bloomsbury) on many occasions over the last 5-6 years and little has changed in that time. Yes, the re-branding in 2010 resulted in new signs and new shower curtains but little else, so the place looks tired in many respects, e.g. old televisions that are not wide screen and are limited to a handful of channels (not even Freeview!!), mini-bars have been removed from most rooms leaving a tatty gap, poor maintenance standards in the lower standard rooms (some are quite grubby), poor quality tea/coffee facilities in the room, etc. This is particularly notable at the prices that they charge. It really is about time they caught up with their competition. Room service isn't great in my experience with things being delivered late, not hot enough or even on one occasion without cutlery! It's also expensive for what you get. You're better off at one of the many restaurants in the surrounding area. Broadband is available in the rooms but at an astronomical £15/day!! I pay less than that for two months access at home. Many other hotels provide free wireless access, so they really ought to be thinking along the same lines. Location in terms of shops, restaurants, bus/tube access is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying in my opinion this is not a 4 star hotel in any sense. Having said that it does have a lot of good points. The location is fantastic and less than a minute walk from the Russell Square Underground station. King's Cross and Euston are further but still also within an easy walk. The area is lively and safe and just across the street is the Brunswick shopping centre which has everything you could need. Check in was fast and friendly but the best part was when I arrived and asked if I could check in early they said yes. Obviously there is no guarantee they will be able to but some hotels just say no. The room was small but had enough space for a solo traveler. Everything inside the room seemed somewhat dated compared to the rest of the hotel. The carpet and furniture looked like it had seen better days. I don't expect to see missing venieer at a 4 star hotel. There was no refrigerator/mini bar although there was a hole where it once was. There was also no iron/board in the room. The bed was comfortable and had a duvet and not a beadspread which I prefer. TV reception was fine - 15 channels most of which are English language. Two channels had audio but a frozen image for the entire time I was there. The bathroom was also small but quite clean. The sink area looked somewhat old and had some chips in it. Towels were thin and the detergent used gave them a less than plesant smell. Although there was virtually no street noise from my 4th floor room facing the shopping centre, you could hear quite a lot from the other rooms and hallway especially in the morning. Internet was quite expensive and cost £15 for 24 hours or £75 per week. Across the street from the Tube station is a mini Tesco market but it is always crowded. There are several others north of the hotel which are open 24 hours and less busy. There is also a full size supermarket in the shopping mall. There is a great fish & chips takeaway called North Sea on Leigh street about 5 minutes north.

Reviews.Title: “still as good as ever”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgigi
Reviews.Content: this is just the best location and the holiday inn here is excellent. It never lets me down and I am reviewing it to assure readers that the standards have been maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: wawest
Reviews.Content: I was acting as a carer for my Quadraplegic sister and was accompanied by my 12 year old son. Holiday Inn was stop 2 of 4, across London and the USA. Tilmann and the team provided far and away the best experience of the four stays with thier professionalism and ability to solve issues quickly. The trip was to prove very problematic in regard to disabled facilties and equipment. For any body travelling with a physically impaired person to London, I suggest Holiday Inn as the place for you to put at the top of your list. Warren West Victoria Australia

Reviews.Title: “Just the place to visit London”
Reviews.Author: Borodog
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn, Coram Street, Bloomsbury, is a modern hotel near Russell Square, ideally placed for a short bus/tube ride into the City centre, yet peaceful on a night time. Fully air conditioned, clean with staff who smile. OK, the rooms are not huge but you don't go to visit London to sit in your bedroom. We had three really good night's sleep there. The hotel is yards away from the bus stop for Trafalgar Square or to Kings Cross/St Pancras/Euston Railway Stations the other way. Breakfasts are ample and buffet style, but a bit pricey unless you get a package to include breakfast in the rate. There is an excellent shopping parade next to the hotel including a Waitrose store. Tesco Express is round the corner for those small items that you often need. There are also a number of small restaurants, which are worth trying. Don't bring a car unless you must - parking is very expensive and anyway a car in London is as useful as a chocolate fireguard.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for going around London”
Reviews.Author: chrissylux
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly. We were disappointed with our room but our daughters and their husbands rooms were great, but we were paying the bill! We did complain while we were there but no success. Complained again at home as we felt we had not been given the room we had booked. Since then we have been contacted and feel much happier about the situation. We thought the breakfast was expensive and so ate out around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option close to the tube.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_spaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed close to the tube Russel Square (no need to transfer to Heathrow and St. Pancras), rooms recently renewed anda good price. Unfortunatelly the breakfast was not included in our rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: BigFatGreekHoliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night: because it was near where I needed to be early next morning. Twin with breakfast for £117 through otel.com, which is pretty good for a branded hotel in Central London. Room was clean, breakfast excellent, staff friendly and helpful. Good location, Russel Square tube just round the corner, Holborn about 10 minutes away with better connections. Lots of good pubs and restaurants nearby. Will certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean with comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: RichardSoutheast
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Single room with a comfortable double bed. Bathroom was clean. Sufficient space for me, although a wide person might find the room awkward. Probably need to upgrade for two people. Caution: Internet was 15BP/day. Breakfast was included and was very good. I must say that the staff was polite and helpful. Location is great: one block from tube, plenty of food places of all types, and a quiet area. Pedestrian shopping mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good but - like all London hotels - too expensive”
Reviews.Author: MWainwright
Reviews.Content: This is everything you'd expect from a Holiday Inn - straightforward, easy to use, comfy, not exciting or characterful but very well-placed, and with friendly staff. It's a bit annoying that you need your card to work the lifts - we had friends and relatives popping in - but otherwise it does a straightforward job very well. My wife and I were looking after my elderly Mum and Uncle whose rooms were adjoining, as requested, and everything was very convenient for people like them whose pace has slowed. Loads of shops and restaurants nearby but it isn't noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JoeinToronto155019
Reviews.Content: second time i have stayed at this holiday inn. great location (next to russel sq tube and st pancras station), comfortable updated rooms, reasonable rate. i'll keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Moleculica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn in July and we loved it. The room is very good size for London, the bed was very comfortable and the location is absolutely perfect!!!! I am very picky in choosing hotels and I stayed in many other hotels in London but this one has been the best. We will certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: KarenAri
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during July and we were very comfortable! The staff was pleasant and accommodating. The location is great - the tube is right around the corner. There's a shopping center across the street with a grocery store and many places to dine. The British Museum is close by and fabulous. We walked all over London from here. If you are in relatively good shape (we are in our late 50's), you can walk to all the sites like Buckingham Palace, Tower of London, etc. Pick up a good walking map first thing. This hotel was a gem for the price. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good, just average”
Reviews.Author: Nicky483
Reviews.Content: First of all, we would like to say that the staff of the hotel was incredibly friendly. When we arrived, the hotel seemed very clean and big. The location is very close to the metrostation so we can't say anything bad about that. When we entered our room, we were kind of dissapointed. It was a bit too small and we had a bed that is not ideal if you have to spend the night in it with your sister. The pillows were great! We liked the fact that you can choose your own type of pillow. What we really missed were bedside tables. I couldn't put my cellphone, book or bottle of water next to me. We were also surprised that we were unable to open the windows. But, luckily we had a great working air conditioning. What bothered me was the view of a wooden construction that should be used as a closet. Imagine waking up with a very small closet without doors RIGHT next to your bed... Weird, don't you think?! Besides a small bed, we also found a small bath/shower. We discovered that we had a problem with our toilet flush, but what we didn't except was a phonecall from the reception to tell us about that. Funny but so sweet at the same time :) What we absolutely didn't like was the noise we heard from the hallway. We would definitely recommend better isolation!!!! The best part of our stay must have been breakfast! We liked the fact that a very kind lady brought us to our table with a smile on her face (as it should be!). Overall, breakfast was nice but our stay in general could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: RossHetherington
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before so I was looking forward to it. I spent 2 nights with with my other half, the first time she has properly been to London. The tube station is great to go anywhere next to the hotel. The room is decent enough, although the showers are a bit lacking. I did find the staff a little bit 'ditzy' in a word, when asking "what time is Breakfast" I got the response just turn up and had to rummage through paperwork in my room to figure it out. Other than that a pleasant stay, would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “VERY FRIENDLY STAFF, GOOD FOOD, LET DOWN BY THE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: lovelyJerseygirl
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying at the Holiday Inn, Bloomsbury for 3 nights. I cannot fault the staff, it was a very warm welcome, however, the problem started when we got to our room. For a family room it was very small and we had a major problem with the shower, well if you can call it a shower. Our son was the first to use it and he was in there for ages, when he eventually came out, he said it took so long because the water wasn't coming out properly. That night I took a shower and there was hardly no water at all and yes it took me ages too. The following morning I complained to the management who said that they would get the maintenance up to fix it. When we came back that afternoon we checked the shower and it was just the same. The worse thing for me was not being able to wash my hair, unfortunately my hair is very thick and shoulder length and I will be very honest, if I had put shampoo on my hair it would have taken ages standing under the trickle of water trying to get it out. That night we were going out to dinner and a show, so I had to go and buy dry shampoo to get me by. We complained three times regarding the shower, which never did improve after it was seen to by maintenance. As a priority card member, I always stay at Holiday Inns or Hotel Intercontinentals and have always being treated extremely well, even on some occasions being offered an upgrade, but this time I felt that we were not treated accordingly and therefore this made our visit a disappointing one. If you are offered Room 612, avoid it because the shower has no pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamLincoln_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 10 mins walk from Euston Station in what appeared to be a decent area of London. It's just off the main street so no traffic noise. Staff were friendly and helpful when we checked in. We upgraded our room so it had a seating area. It was very clean and modern just what we wanted. I liked the little touches - you could choose your type of pillow. Had a plesant nights sleep and it wasn't too busy considering there was a wedding party. The breakfast was fine - the usual buffet style - again staff helpful. Located very near a tube station and lots of local shops nearby. Good Irish pub attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: andrewashcroftsnr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug.27/30,excellent room, with all mod coms, fridge, trouser press, hairdryer, tv coffee and tea making facilities.Main reason for staying was a show in the Dominion Theatre called We will rock You.Superb performance.Another reason was my ambition to visit The Imperial War Museum in Lambeth.This turned out to be particularly easy as the number 63 bus stops virtually out side the hotel, Getting off at St stevens Circus meant a 4 min walk to the museum.Had two particularly memorable meals during our stay, the first a summer lunch at restaurant Sade,in Exmouth market, a turkish,/med menu at 7.99pounds superb value for the two courses.The other at the Easton gastro pub, Easton street ,a 2 min walk from the hotel, excellent food and service.The hotel is an easy 12 min walk from kings Cross station,even with luggage and a 30 min walk to the dominion theatre.Would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but beware the hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: ScottyPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and reasonably priced, the rooms are clean however small but adequate for a short stay. The staff are polite and helpful. My only concern was the hidden costs of using extra services. I utilised the telephone to make two phone calls, one (15mins) to Australia and one (10mins) to Dublin, these calls cost me 80 British Pounds, which is nothing short of daylight robbery. I believe I should have been made aware of this cost prior to the call as I later used a public telephone to make similar calls, which cost me only a fraction of that sum. Therefore I would recommend the hotel however do not use any of the extra services.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely convenient hotel, good sized clean room with comfortable bed, fabulous breakfast and friendly polite staff”
Reviews.Author: marandi65
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend and loved it. What the building lacks in character is made up for by everything else. The room was clean, well decorated and a very good size. The mini bar was no longer used as such but could be used as a fridge which was great to keep milk and drinks in. The rooms were cleaned and supplies replenished every day. A bathrobe and slippers were also provided. Breakfast was a buffet and had everything you could want and was kept well stocked, so much so that we never needed lunch. The staff were friendly and helpful and you could leave your luggage after checkout. Location is great too - two minutes from Russell Square Tube Station. After reading so may scare stories in reviews about London hotels, I was apprehensive before my stay - the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury quickly dispelled my fears. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: fiveducks
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, a Saturday and booking through Premier Club this cost about £90 b&b. The standard is pretty much what you would expect in a big city Holiday In, reasonably modern and well appointed with good size ad comfortable room but lacking in character. Staff efficient and polite. Very good location by Russell Square tube but might not be quite as central for the West End as a tourist might wish. Lifts a bit slow and breakfast a bit of a bear garden but overall no complaints and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend enough.”
Reviews.Author: ellarhys
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short break to London (3 nights) and having stayed at the Holiday Inn, Bloomsbury can honestly say that it couldn't be faulted. The rooms are comfortable and clean with tea/coffee facilities and individual heating/air con controls in each room. Rooms are cleaned and beds made daily, as well as towels changed if required. We stayed on a bed & breakfast basis and cannot commend the breakfast enough - wow! All you could ask for and more - fresh fruit, full cooked english breakfast, cheeses, meats, cereal, fruit, toast, bagettes, pastries. There were also poached/boiled eggs and porride available to order as well as tea/coffee at your table. Everything was of excellent quality and standard and although I'm not a great breakfast person I couldn't wait for breakfast each morning. The restaurant is also open for lunch and dinner and main courses were around £12 each although huge portions. You could also get snacks for from £2.95 each. All of the staff, from the house keeping, bar staff and reception were friendly and helpful. We even had a fire alarm at 0645 when we were there and although startling (I think that, that was more the time I was woken!!) it was well co-ordinated and staff were apologising on our return for any inconvenience (turned out to be a false alarm, thankfully as we'd left the car keys in the room!). The hotel is also just across the road from a small shopping centre, with a Somerfield, Superdrug, and a few clothes shops and food places. We had a fantastic stay and a good location without being right in the centre of London. It cost us around £6 from the hotel to Trafalgar Square in a taxi, which was a good central point to go on from (and cheaper than a bus as these were £2 each for a single journey). We will not hesitate to go back when we visit London again and would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for somewhere to stay for one or more nights

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Obliging Staff High Level of Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: parnabyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two daughters in double rooms on forth floor. Both rooms were spotlessly clean and kept that way during our stay. The staff at all times were efficient friendly and helpful, Gary especially so. He was knowledgeable and very approachable. The hotel itself is only a three minute walk from the tube station and just round the corner from coffe shops snack bars and a couple of supermarkets. We ate one evening at an Italian restaurant called Balfours . Very good . We found the whole area a good place to stay and are planning on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: samHartlepool
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night break at the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury booked through Superbreak and are already planning our return. From the moment we stepped in the building we could not have been helped more. Gary on guest services is an asset to the hotel and will do anything within his power to help you find what you are looking for. He helped us with theatre tickets (we went to see Oliver and would highly reccomend), gave us discounted pizza express vouchers and reccommended restaurants. The room we had on the 6th floor was fab very spacious considering we had 3 people in the room. The bathroom was spotless and we got clean towels everyday. Breakfast was delicious with everything from cereal to full english to fruit. We would highly reccomend this hotel to others wishing to stay in a central London Hotel as its round the corner from Russell Square tube station and within walking distance from Kings Cross. As a travel agent i have stayed in numerous London hotels and this one tops them all so far.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Sandradunn4
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for four nights bed and breakfast having taken advantage of an excellent value pre-paid option. As requested by e-mail we were given a room on the sixth floor in case traffic noise was an issue. In the event the bedroom windows are triple-glazed and we need not have worried. The room was spacious and the bathroom well-equipped and spotless. The buffet breakfast was excellent with various choices available including full "English". The hotel is well located for the tube, buses, shops, restaurants and pub - what else do you need? The high point of the stay was that all the staff we encountered were efficient and exceedingly pleasant - obviously staff training is a priority for management. Highly recommended - will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MikeWReading
Reviews.Content: I stayed in two different 'executive' rooms on the 1st floor: one (room 111) had a good layout although not particularly spacious, but the second room had a pillar separating the desk from the TV so you can't see it while working (room 108). Again, in room 108 throughout night a loud clicking noise could be heard every few minutes, disturbing my sleep. The minibar in room 108 was not clean (and the contents extortionately priced - try Hotel Indigo, another Holiday Inn brand where they are free!). Internet access costs a ridiculous £15 for 24 hours (again free at Hotel Indigo!). The contents of one of the milk cartons was solid; there were two shoeshines and no shower cap in one room, the complimentary newspaper (only The Independent is offered free to Priority Club guests) was not delivered to room 111 and there was a pen but no notepad in room 108. The towel in 108 had marks on it. All minor things, but indicative of the lack of attention to detail at the hotel. Shame, because it has a good location, near Russell Square tube and right next to a shopping mall with a variety of eateries and posh supermarket Waitrose.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny little room, but solid service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Skimmingtn
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided my family and I with good service (always friendly and quick to respond to requests), a clean room, and an ideal location. It is just steps away from the Russell Square underground station. We were across the street from a Waitrose grocery (important for those traveling with little ones.) There plenty of places to eat, with all types of cuisine, within a short, easy walk. And the British Museum was a ten-minute walk away. My only quibbles: Our room was tiny, easily the smallest I've ever seen. There was a two foot gap between the foot of the bed and the wall. The "closet" was a tiny recess with about a foot between it and the bed. They also managed to somehow squeeze in a desk and a table. With two adults and a toddler, we found ourselves constantly in each others' ways. It really should have been a single, not a double. Also, out of four hotels that we stayed at during our European vacation, this was the most expensive, but the only one that didn't provide wi-fi. It was 25 pounds for 24 hours to use their internet. We found a couple of coffee shops nearby and used theirs instead. (The Costa coffee shop is just up the street and there is a small French bakery in the shopping comlpex across the street - both have reasonable prices and free wi-fi.)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly ok...”
Reviews.Author: reportingfromupclose
Reviews.Content: - Close to tube - Outside looks bleak but surprisingly nice and modern lobby - Rooms are ok; like any holiday inn - May have to walk 2-3 mins for a cab since its not available outside hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: catwomen7
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Right next to the tube which is very important . Tip: invest in the double decker bus with the ferry trip just to get your bearings. I had a wonderfu time people were very friendly and helpful throughout the city. A trip to the city Bath was wonderful. Can't wait to return. LUV LUV LUV it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisadakin
Reviews.Content: We used airmiles to pay for our one night stay, having stayed in a the Holiday Inn at Kensington. We couldn't fault the service, we arrived 3hrs before check-in time, expecting to just leave our luggage, but a room was available straight away! Very impressed! The room was exactly what you'd expect, clean, tidy and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious too! And the hotel was very well situated near to Russell Square tube station! There are only two faults I can find! The first was a group of rowdy gentleman returning in the small hours of the morning! Not really the fault of the hotel! But the second is an issue that could, and should, be rectified! There is a loud gurgling that comes from the plug hole of the bathroom sink! It happened quite regularly through the night and woke us up repeatedly! We stayed in room 429!! Other than that, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JeanR92
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean the staff were very friendly and the location was great

Reviews.Title: “Remember, staying in the UK is not like US”
Reviews.Author: Semomu
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean, friendly, helpful staff. Nice restaurant, close to a tube station, restaurants and shopping. However, this is the UK. Rooms are smaller; no free breakfast like US Holiday Inns. As a Priority member, you only receive a newspaper and a late check out. For amenties you receive shampoo, body wash and hand soap. No shower cap, hair conditioner or skin cream. Towels are thin and you only receive one hand, wash cloth and bath towel. There are NO electrical plugs in the bathroom. Bring an adapter and plug into the coffee/tea pot outlet. Hair dryers are bolted into the top drawer of the desk - yes bolted. You must walk back and forth from the bathroom, to the outlet to the desk to work on your hair (more difficult for women). Easier to air-dry hair and put into a clip. There are no views - so ask for a quiet room instead of one that faces a street. The best part - wonderful beds and a choice of firm or soft pillow. Slept great - except for street noise. Selection of in-room tea/coffee is very nice. Restaurant and bar was also very good. Priced fairly. Yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, deluxe rooms, near tube stop! = WONDERFUL VALUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissPlanner
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again. My fiance and I stayed at a hostel in Hyde Park the beginning of our trip, then went to Paris (lovvvvvved it), then came back to London for a few days. When booking a Holiday Inn, I felt kind of silly, since it is such an American chain, but I got a fabulous rate on an internet travel site (expedia) where they allow you to book a hotel for only a portion of your stay while booking your flight for the greatest savings.. FABULOUS... and it came out to less than $25 a night/per person. Ha ha. I felt like I stole the room. The room was way nicer than any Holiday in in the States. The rooms were small, but appointed extremely well. They were very contemporary and swank. The location is fantastic. A tube stop is a stone's throw away. Literally, just down the street. And that Tube line is a very popular one so it takes you everywhere around the city. I will MOST definitely try and get this hotel again on our next visit... if I can get it as cheaply. . . if not, you'll be reading my next review for somewhere else I got a deal on. Ha ha.

Reviews.Title: “easy location”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgigi
Reviews.Content: yes, this is a pretty standard place BUT it is £5 in a cab from Euston station, 2 minutes walk from Russell Square tube station, right next to a good pub - the Marquis of ?(forget the next bit) and the tiny Chinese restaurant about 4 doors up from that, is as good as anything you find in Chinatown. There is a Waitrose and a tesco about a half minute away - so all in all a great location and that is as much as you can ever want in London.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial incinerator in the heart of Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: I visited here on business, and was very busy so I saw little of the hotel or its staff, but there wasn't anything to entice me to hang around there. However, it is my custom to write about the places I stay in, and I didn't see why I shouldn't tax myself to say something of the Holiday Inn in Bloomsbury. The location is excellent: close to many attractions like the British Museum, and some excellent architecture, though its own design is unforgivably poor (think local council building circa 1983). The approach makes you feel as if you are visiting a factory. Room was very small, bathroom the same, but all places in London are stuck for space. Breakfast good, staff very professional, but barely a native amongst them. Mind you, London these days seems organised solely for young people from member states of the EU to do some overseas work experience and perfect their english, so this is not so unusual. The system for the lifts has, I think, become commonplace in Holiday Inns, where the thing won't move without you inserting your room card (=very irritating if you have your bags and stuff). There is a tired looking barbecue area out the front that seemed occupied by even more tired looking boozers whenever I walked past it. Whilst someone clearly thinks this is a good idea to improve the sight of the place, the layout of the front could do with some serious rethinking to move away from the industrial/civic building feel it has. All in all, an unremarkable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely no good”
Reviews.Author: rbenamor
Reviews.Content: Comparing to others hotels in the same category this one is not good at all, and has a lot of inconvenients, cheafly in the bathroons.. the doors are to heavy, the water tap is made of plastic which make it very hard to open without breaking... Indeed to achive the hot water you should pass by the cold one and shower can be a bad expierence.. The room is not so bad. But, internet service is not fair, cause they charge by I.P. (each computer) and not by room, as it should be... I´ve been twice in London before and stayed at Radisson Edwardian, which has the same price, but service and location are much better... I am going to avoid Holliday Inn on my next hollidays...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: tilz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night, friendly at check in and the room was pretty decent (i did have an exec room though so cant comment on the others) Didn't eat here but it seemed busy and there was a irish bar attached/next door Tube station was right around the corner, overall good hotel and I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best for Business Travel-Has it all that you need for Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Advisor1803
Reviews.Content: Have been staying in Holiday Inn whenever I go on business to London. Location is extrmelly good and so is the neighbourhood. Very close to the undergroud station. All ameneties provided to make your hotel saty comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Firstly the service I received from Elena...”
Reviews.Author: Wheresmypants
Reviews.Content: Firstly the service I received from Elena prior to our stay was excellent and very helpful. Give the lady a promotion as she is an asset to the hotel!   After a 14 hour flight SIN > LHR we went straight to the hotel expecting not to be able to check-in until 2.00pm. I decided to upgrade my room to an executive room which meant I could check-in straight away at 8.30am. Initial impressions of the room were great. More spacious than I would expect from London. There was a sofa and writing desk which was a great extra space for the luggage. The bathroom was modern and clean. The water pressure was excellent and hot water plentiful. Bathroom amenities smelled really nice. There was an iron and board along with trouser press, tea and coffee facilities and a mini bar fridge. There was also an in room safe and climate control air con.   Location wise you cannot beat it. Literally 2 minutes walk to Russell Square tube station and a 10 minute walk to Kings Cross / St. Pancras. 50m from the front door is the Brunswick centre which has at least 5 places to get dinner ranging from cafe's to Italian or Japanese restaurants.  There is also a supermarket and ATM handy.  The staff a very pleasant and helpful. There were times when the lobby was packed with tour groups but the reception staff were always cheerful and attentive. We never ate at the hotel but there were a few restaurants available and 2 pubs downstairs. The hotel had a summer BBQ setup at the front of the hotel during our stay which proved to be popular when the weather permitted.     Pros:  Location Staff / service Good standard of room (executive) Good surrounds Rooms get cleaned early in the day Cons: Air conditioning varied a lot during the night even though it was left set on the one setting. Rooms are not very noise proof. But to the rooms credit I think the guy next door was building some sort of ark in his room, lots of banging.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Hattersfan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package via Show and Stay. The hotel was in an ideal location for the Cambridge theatre (2 stops on the underground) and 1 stop from St Pancras main line station. The staff were friendly and professional. Our room was fine, and the breakfast was really good. I would recommend the hotel to anyone coming to London, especially if you are going to the theatre, or Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: karliesangel
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in this hotel. The location couldn't be better, very close to Russell Square tube staion on the Piccadily line, we didn't have to change to get to and from Heathrow. Lots of restaurants in the area. The staff were friendly. There was a good selection for breakfast which was great for me as I'm not a big cooked breakfast fan. The bathroom was a bit small but it was clean and functional. I will definitely used this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, dodgy stair case”
Reviews.Author: PeteMaxwell
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpfull and the hotel very clean and welcoming. The only fault is the fact that my wife has a lift phobia, therefore we had to use the stairs to get to the second floor which wasn't a problem, we are used to it, but the actual stair case area was like the tradesmans entrance. Stuck away in the back corner, plain concrete steps no wall decoration etc. A little bit of effort in this area would have improved our stay just that little bit. Overall very good though

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tonynclaire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very enjoyable 3 night break staying in this hotel, one arrival the staff where very friendly and on arrival in our room we where phoned to see if the room was okay for us (which it was). Bathroom was a bit small but we have stayed in a lot worse in London! The rooms could do with sound proofing as we could hear noise from the bar below and from the refuge collection the following morning. Please dont let this put you off though as I am a very light sleeper! The hotel was in a great location with a good number of eaterys around and about, also russell sq tube was only a 30 second walk from the entrance. I would definately recommend anyone to stay here and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, good location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: D_Travel5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend. The hotel is very close to Russell Square tube station so it is easy to get around. The British Museum is also very close by. The hotel itself was not very pretty from the outside but the inside was standard modern decor and the room was clean although a bit on the small side - I expected this with it being a central hotel. The breakfast was good, plenty of food, good selection and service. There is a small shopping centre nearby which is very handy, with a few restaurants and bars. Lots of good amenities around the hotel. Overall staying here was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Disabled Guest's Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Casmana_UK
Reviews.Content: Have no doubts if you're disabled , this hotel caters well enough ! On entry I was impressed by the spacious clean lobby and reception area . Well attended by pleasnat staff, Nathan in particular was very helpful and informative. Looking at reviews I can see complaints about room size but this didn't apply in my case. The room I had was for wheelchair use so there was plenty of room to account for this . The bathroom had a wide entrance via a sliding door and was well fitted out . Very low bath and a shower and the usual aids for a disabled person were in there .[I was given to understand that some disabled rooms had a hoist] Lots of clean towels . Self regulating air conditioning . Plenty of room in the resataurant where an excellent breakfast was to be had. The hotel itself is in a prime position close to the main road but set back in a quiet place. A shopping centre almost on the hotel doorstep including a Waitrose and Bootsand lots of shops in nearby streets . I would most definitely choose to stay at this hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “I've got a bigger cupboard at home”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: The downside of this hotel, has to be the size of the rooms. Its the second time I've stayed here, so to be honest I was expecting it - and I wasn't surprised the rooms were small. Smaller than travelodge, or Holiday Inn Express. The common area of the hotel has had a revamp and resembles a 4 star hotel, but unfortunately thats where it stops, they don't seem to have extended the revamp to the bedrooms, so they are really nothing special. I can't complain too much though, I paid £65 for 1 night, but its not worth anymore than this, there aren't really that many facilities at the hotel, although its very handy for Russell Sq tube station and there is a Tesco Express near by.

Reviews.Title: “Harry Potter's cupboard under the stairs was bigger than our room”
Reviews.Author: Travelrug
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel that was close to a Piccadilly Line station, and HI Bloomsbury seemed to fit the bill. We arrived after 2pm, and went to check in. The Receptionist was unsmiling and unwelcoming. We were told that we couldn't have an upgrade (as a PC Platinum member we should get upgrades if there was a room available, but the hotel was full) but that we had a 'nice' room. A 'Business' room, she called it. But it wasn't available, despite the 'Priority Check-in™ ensuring your room and key are ready upon your arrival' promise for PC members. So we hung around in reception, having been told by the receptionist that it would be 5 minutes, and she'd call us when it was ready. We found a seat in full view of the desk and waited for 5 minutes. And another 5. And another. And then two more 5 minutes. Still no news, so we go and ask, and were given the key. No apology for the delay. No apology for not doing as they said they would. But at least we can now get up to the room. So up we go. Travelodges have bigger rooms. So do Holiday Inn Expresses. Hell, even Harry's cupboard was bigger. The bed has about 18" of space around it. If you sit at the desk - which is mostly taken up by an old TV - you can't get round the bed. The room furniture was scruffy, with dents and scrapes on the walls and bits falling off the bedsides. Remember - this is a 'nice' - a *business* - room. I feel sorry for anyone in a standard room. The bed was a standard double. As comfortable as any HI bed. Breakfast was actually pretty good, if you ignore the inedible orange segment, bitter instant coffee and over cooked hash browns. We asked for a late check out, and spoke to a different receptionist, who was helpful, polite, and efficient. Essentially, this place should rebrand itself as a HI express, and drop the prices. I have significant IHG brand loyalty, but this place is not up to scratch. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “If I had a cat I couldnt have swung it”
Reviews.Author: Cactustoaster
Reviews.Content: Paid premium to be placed in the 3rd floor which the hallway was painted white the doors were a bit worn annd a bit tired. Arrived at my very small room to a strong smell of bleach that was overpowering. Im not that fussy but I couldnt have stayed in the room more that 10 mins. Reception then moved me to the 4th floor the hallway was better adn the room had been refurbished but still very small. For the money it wasnt really good value as i hve stayed in london for a lot less. Breakfast was poor, croissants not fresh and fried stuff cold. Generally very tired and needing some investment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday, very good location”
Reviews.Author: RussellEngland
Reviews.Content: I had previously been to this hotel on a business conference and knew that it was a good location. It is in a side street and is very quiet. I had not had a room, however. The room was a double room. They are very clean and comfortable but a bit on the small side. That said, a great location if you want the theatres. It is an easy 15 minute walk to most theatres around Leicester Square. Would I go back - yes I would. Can't have a better comment that that I guess

Reviews.Title: “Never book this Holiday Inn nearabouts New Year. One of the few not-so-good experiences had in any HI hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: WanderingVeidt
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for the likes of us, a family spending a leisure week-long vac in London with particular interests in museums (British Museum is truly within walking distance even in fiercest London Winter for decades). Underground station very close by and with many connections somewhere up or down the line if not directly from this particular Piccadilly Line station (Russell Square). Hotel staff was friendly enough because they mistook my family for someone whose native language was english. All the brochures and online info about multilingual staff were reduced to one chambermaid speaking half-portuguese and one other speaking fully fledged delightful portuguese, the former being Hispanic and the latter Brazilian. The restaurant was not a disapointment nor the (non-included in our case) Breakfast Buffet because we knew what to expect. The Irish Bar may have overtones of Irishness in its choice of the most expensive spirits and some good old fashioned Guiness but otherwise it's misleading. It's an American or Anglo-American Sports Bar. Sole focus was on soccer as far as we were able to tell. Rooms were no more than adequate for the chain & price and seriously lacking in soundproof of any sort. To be fair I believe the hotel was undergoing some major renovation (upgrade? I sure hope so) at the time. Not that our travel agency or the online downlowdable brochures made any mention of it. The noise making it in from the surrounding streets (all of them relatively low on traffic for this part of London) was a nuisance. I'd like to see a better offer of wifi, food and daily maintenace of rooms on a future return and I believe it to be possible. Location, Location, Service. If you have 2 that's no excuse to neglect the 3rd. Overall: met minimal expections at medium price and annoying circumstances. I wish them all the best with their "renovation".

Reviews.Title: “Good, Quiet Location - Rather Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TsarTsarGabor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights at the end of April so we could visit some of the sights of London. The location is great - near the British Museum and in a quiet area with very little road noise. Checking in to the hotel we were told the room had been upgraded to an executive room as we were Platinum Ambassador members of the Priority Club Rewards scheme. However, when we entered the room this was obviously not the case. No minibar, No bathrobes/slippers, no upgraded toiletries and worst of all - NO SAFE. I cannot believe a hotel not providing room safes in 2010 !. This has put us off returning to this particular property as other Holiday Inns have always been more accomodating to Platinum Ambassodor level customers. The rooms are clean and functional although a little dated. The rest of the hotel looked fine and the staff were pleasant enough. Overall, a nice hotel, centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location !”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stay there for 3 days end March/Early April. Of all the hotels we stayed in during our current trip, this is the best hotel. Stayed in all holiday inn & associated hotels during this trip, except for Paris. Location of hotels is good, straight ahead after getting out of russell square tube station with a 24 hours Tesco Express at the rear of the Hotel City Block. There are loads of restaurant further down Cartwright Gardens. Found a Chippy round the corner and had my fill of fish & Chips and did my laundry as well. Services of hotels is good. I was concluding some business in Australia and the support I got from the hotel staff is good eventhough there is no purpose build business centre. Staff is very friendly, helpful and would try their very best to help, had a very pleasant stay and would stay again. Stay with 2 kids, age 10 & 12, sofa bed is comfy for them. Room is spacious enough even with the sofa bed extended. Decor is slightly under for a 4 star but the service and location has more than compensate for it. This hotel is more expensive than the Crown Plaza we stayed in Kensington, has lower standard of decor but made us feel very relaxed and welcomed here ! Breakfast has good spread, fairly standard menu for all holiday inn hotels. Posted a picture on the room with the sofa bed extended, I couldnt find a picture of this hotel with the sofa bed extended in the room taken by a guest.. This hotel will be our regular hotel for years to come. You have won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: eastridingowl
Reviews.Content: Mixed business with pleasure and stayed at the Holiday Inn for a weekend. Often grumble about road noise in London, but this was very quiet. Room and bed comfortable, service good and good evening meal and breakfast. Not a great deal of character, and a dull building, but very comfortable and well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Location for Visiting London with Children”
Reviews.Author: Todwicker
Reviews.Content: We just had a 3 day 2 night trip to London and stayed at the Holiday Inn. I knew we were heading to a budget hotel, but for 2 nights the location and reviews led me to book. The location was superb for Russell Square tube station and 5 minutes by taxi from Kings Cross. As previous reviews stated rooms are small but at the end of the day they are only for sleeping in!. There was a very good selection for Breakfast and we pre-booked this on our room price fro £10.00. There is an Irish bar that ajoins the hotel and it had live Sky Sports so ideal for taking in the major matches. Took in all the major sights, Good advice to go to see changing of the guard at HOrse Guards Parade because you couldn't see a thing a Buckingham Palace as it was so packed. Our Daughters favourites (age 8) were the History Museum (South Kensington Station) (she had to touch everything) you need to set aside a good few hours here, and London Dungeon(London Bridge station)- some good advice would be to pre-book your tickets for this attraction as we had to queue for 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CocoukSouthCoast
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but clean. Cost of internet was £15 a night which is a total rip off. Restaurant had a fair range fpr breakfast but could have been better. I have booked early at my usual hotel to avoid having to stay at the Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes good, sometimes bad”
Reviews.Author: Mr_R_Baron
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now. The rooms vary. I'm a platinum priority card holder so I sometimes get an upgrade here. Stay 1: Executive room, very nice. Fire alarm at 9am on a Saturday morning meant I missed breakfast. Stay 2: Upgraded to a very large exec room. Great stay Stay 3: Was told I was upgraded, but I'm sure I wasn't as the room seemed just like a regular room. No iron in the room, had to ask for one every day, even though I told them just to leave it. The bar here is an Irish bar. It's nice when it's quiet but can get a bit rowdy when football is on. Seems to attract some locals, some of which seem a bit drunk. Overall, mixed feelings about this hotel. I'd only stay here again if the rate was good. Otherwise I'd pick somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: Belcasino
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a short break in London. The location in Bloomsbury is excellent - you are a short walk from Russel Square tube station and there are good shops/bars/restaurants nearby. The hotel is quite large and functional rather than charming and full of character, but it suited our needs. Our room was a decent size and well-furnished (although we didn't have the advertised stereo). Bathroom was large and clean with a bath and shower. Our only complaint was the beds were very uncomfortable - I like a firm mattress but this was so hard and uncomfortable none of our group (5 of us in 3 rooms) had great sleep unfortunately. We also had a very noisy fridge in our room (which was bizarrely empty!) which kept waking me up. That aside, this is a good place to stay and I would consider staying here again, provided I got a good rate we booked ours through Last Minute and it cost £190 per room for both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good quality, recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: Nice room - we had a reasonably spacious twin room, very clean and comfortable. I'd recommend this hotel, no negative points, though for the price we paid, I'd expect nothing less. Thats London for you though! They have a "pillow menu" where you can ask for a pillow of your choice (the standard bed pillows are synthetic and perfectly ok). I'm not normally fussy about these things but given that it was on offer we were forking out quite a lot, I decided I'd ask for a feather one. It never appeared, and we stayed up for a while wondering if they would knock on the door as we were falling asleep. Didn't happen - don't advertise these things if you're not going to deliver! I found the room nice and quiet considering the central London location. Bit too warm though, and it was a freezing night in January! Great location for visiting London - close to tube and Kings X, Russell Square etc. I'd come back here, but maybe not in summer!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, let down by the building”
Reviews.Author: naked37
Reviews.Content: The staff on the check in desk were very polite, the restaurant staff slightly less so but they weren't rude - just less cheery and enthusiastic. There's no stairs to the upper floors which means you have to wait for a lift, even if you're only going up 1 floor. My room was reasonably sized. It wasn't particularly big, but it was big enough. Could have been made a million times better though if there wasn't a great big concrete column running through the centre of it, obscuring the view of the television! (see photo) Other problems included: - Being woken by banging when other nearby rooms closed doors or used the bathroom - Single glazed windows which let the traffic noise in (it was bin day the following morning) - Single glazed windows meant the room was very cold, even with the blinds shut. I put the noisy heater on for an hour which made it a more comfortable temperature but within half an hour it had gone arctic again. If I'd paid £30 for the night I would have put up with this but I don't know how central London hotels can get away with charging well over £100 a night for this sort of rubbish accommodation! I paid £25 for a night in another Holiday Inn outside London and the accommodation was far, far better.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: davedThurrock
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel. Usual Holiday Inn. The rooms were a bit small but very clean. I did expect bigger for the money I paid but it is central London. The Restaurant was modern, stylish and the food was very good. We had an enjoyable meal there. Staff were friendly. Never had room service so I cannot comment on that nor Breakfast, did not have time! Excellent parking with Car park next door at a reasonable price for that area. I would go back again if I was around that area. The only bad points that I have were the view was obscured and the price was a bit steep. In the bathroom there could of been more towels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve5839
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late due to the train being delayed and got to the hotel about 11pm. The hotel is off the main road and as such the rooms are quiet and peaceful. On checking in I asked if I had been upgraded (I am a PCR Member) and was told no, ok but bearing in mind this was 11 o’clock and the HI web site was still showing executive rooms I was a little disappointed; I was offered an “Executive Pack” though. The hotel has a very smart foyer and looks to have been refurbished quite recently; the style is that “officie” type look, which is very good if you like it. The room I was allocated was a little small, but I was only in it for 7 hours, so all in all it was ok. I had a drink in the bar and they have a waitress service which is quite a nice touch. The hotel is very well placed with regard to Euston and the tube Russell Square; I did not have breakfast so cannot comment, but I find them all very similar quality. Would I stop there again, yes it was a good solid London hotel with great travel connections.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in London”
Reviews.Author: davidbowen1953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together with our disabled daughter recently spent a night at this hotel following a visit to the Theatre, we have stayed in this area before but our fist time at this particular hotel and we will be staying again, the hotel is very modern and clean with very pleasant lobby and bar etc. The room was of a reasonable size for this part of London and again very clean. Th hotel is situated in a quite side street just of the main road Southampton Row and is just a short pleasant walk from the West End Theatres, Covent Garden and Oxford Street. There is a car park under the hotel which is much better value than many in the area and in our case two disabled bays at the fron of the hotel. The welcome we received from all of the staff was 1st class, nothing was to much trouble for them. We will be sure to book another weekend at this hotel again soon, as it is also excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Dec 25th to Dec 28th. Hotel was clean, service was good, the location was excellent so nothing to complain. There was a shopping mall with various types of restaurant close by so we went there for dinner which was good. Only negative was the parking. Parking beneath the hotel was closed during our stay so I had to park my car on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haulfri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a coach trip holiday, and was very dubious, after reading previous comments on trip advisor about this hotel. The hotel is described as being in Kingscross, but is a 10 minute walk or bus ride in to the centre of Kingscross, where you can either pick up the bus or tube in to the centre of London. There is a bus stop 200 yards from the hotel, which will take you down in to Kingscross. Taking the bus is much cheaper, if you get a day card, you will be able to travel all day on any bus, one tip, if you do take the bus you will be able to see a lot of the main sights on the way in to the centre of London. The hotel we thought was lovely, our room was very clean, and very well decorated, the bed was very comfortable, and the room had all the usual amenities. Breakfast was very plentiful, with a wide choice to suit everybody, we found the staff to be very friendly, and helpful. The car park is not very big if you’re taking your car, and was very full the entire time we were there. Our only criticism was the walk in price of the hotel, we found the hotel very good value for money, for what we paid, being on an organised trip, but I don't think the hotel is worth the walk in price being advertised, I know hotels in London are pricey but this hotel is on the outskirts, catching the tube was not cheap, but the buses are far more reasonable once you get the hang of them. The hotel provides meals in the evening at an extra price, the food offered is Indian, and looked lovely, although we never tried it, but if you don’t like Indian food, there is not much choice for an evening meal in the area. This hotel was great for a short break, but I wouldn’t want to stay here if staying longer than a weekend because of the location. Overall this is a fab hotel and I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a shopping weekend”
Reviews.Author: Spelios
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and took this hotel especially because it's close to the tube (Russel Square station is only a minutes walk) to go shopping in London. The room was rather small, but clean. The breakfast was as it should be, a real English breakfast so no complains at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bland and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: honda124
Reviews.Content: Typical Holiday Inn. Basic and small rooms. To get to around the bed you had to walk sideways. Price of room did not include breakfast, which was £16.99 extra and is good value if they were serving wild boar stuffed with truffles, served on solid gold plates, by naked and experinced nymphomaniacs. but as it was bog standard British fare its nothing short of highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for central London and Theatreland”
Reviews.Author: Jothegiraffe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a combined business and shopping/theatre break. It's less than a minute's walk from Russell Sq Tube, which is on the Piccadilly line to Leicester Sq, Covent Garden etc and therefore theatreland. Perfect location. There isn't anything attractive about this hotel, from the smokers outside to the sanitised and typically green/gold lobby/lifts/corridors. But there was nothing wrong with it either. The welcome was warm and informative, the rooms a respectable size, there was no din, the breakfast was up to standard (with a chef in situ so you can have eggs to order - I loved the chef 2 days who served the eggs and said "enjoy lady"). My daily paper was outside my door each morning at 5am. If you can overlook the aesthetics, stay here. You could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: JaneDub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a weekend trip to London. The location is great - right beside Russel square tube station and you can easily walk to Convent Garden. The hotel is in a nice quiet location with a nearby shopping centre (Brunswick). The room was very small but we only slept in it as there is so much to do and see in London! The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. I got a good deal for 3 nights through the internet and only paid €300 (per room) for the 3nights, so I can't really complain! We did not get breakfast with this deal - when we asked, breakfast would have cost £16 in the hotel - so we opted to go to the shopping center next door where there are lots of breakfast spots (Starbucks, Giraffe etc.) I would recommend this hotel for busy weekend tourists who want to be central. At the end of the day a Holiday Inn is a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: VandA_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10-15mins walk from Euston station, not far from Tavistock Square. My room was clean enough, and not too small compared to other central London hotels I've stayed in. The bathroom was a bit pokey, but well equiped with a shower with great water pressure. One bad point about the bathroom was this oddly positioned vent that was just above the toilet and near the shower - surely this should be higher up the wall??? Check in was quick and easy, although they seemed very keen to get you to join their Proirity CLub (I didnt). Check out again was quick Food: I only had a breakfast, which was bought to my room via the request card. Nice selection of food (I had continental style) although I didnt think when I ordered the yoghurt that I'd get a bowl full of it - could only manage a few spoonfuls. Service: Breakfast was delivered about 15mins early, but not a problem. However, a cleaner was very keen to get into my room twice whilst I was eating my breakfast. The first time (just after 8am) she used her master key to just walk into my room. After a mumbled apology, I encountered a knock at the door again about 20mins later........ it was the same cleaner desperate to get into my room.
